column2: A small, cheap sword.\nMore useful for daily\ntasks than for combat.
column3: 价格便宜的轻巧的短剑。\n日常用途也可使用，其\n战斗效果无法期待过高。

column2: A steel long sword.\nFairly heavy, but gets\nthe job done nicely.
column3: 钢铁制的长剑。剑身结构较宽，\n较为笨重，不易于使用，但是其\n战斗中发挥的力量不可小看。

column2: A sword from the far\neast. Its curved blade\nslices like a dream.
column3: 据传是来自于遥远的东方的\n贵重刀剑。弯曲的锋利刀刃\n隐藏着绝大的破坏力。

column2: An ornately decorated\nlong sword. Its silver\nglow can destroy evil.
column3: 附有华丽装饰的长剑。\n刀身放出的银白色光芒\n藏有消灭邪恶存在之力。

column2: An unmatchably strong,\nfiery blade. Nothing\ncan stand against it.
column3: 刀身有火炎缠绕的最强魔剑。\n其斩击会穿透物质，且将物质\n燃烧殆尽，令对手无从招架。

column2: A small buckler of\nreinforced hardwood.\nCheap, but unreliable.
column3: 质地坚硬的木材经过补强制成的\n小盾牌。价格便宜、使用容易，\n但是强度与守备范围都不甚理想

column2: A leather-lined shield\nof medium size. Light,\ndurable and firm.
column3: 内层用软化后的皮革打造的中形\n盾牌。体积大却重量轻、易于使\n用，而且强度还算不错。

column2: A large steel shield.\nHeavy and bulky, but\noffers great defense.
column3: 用钢铁做成的大型盾牌。\n笨重而难以使用，但是\n拥有卓越的防御力。

column2: A breathtaking silver\nshield inscribed with\nprotective blessings.
column3: 有着美丽细致的装饰的银白盾牌\n。上面刻有对女神的祈祷，\n让邪恶者无法靠近。

column2: A shield imbued with\nfiery zeal. Deflects\nalmost all attacks.
column3: 此盾牌得到烈火之力的加护。\n视使用者的能力，潜藏着\n可阻挡各种攻击的防御力。

column2: Finely woven chain\nmail. Easy to move in,\nbut rather weak.
column3: 以细细的铁链编织而成的防具。\n通风而便于身体活动，但是，\n缺点是承受打击的能力较弱。

column2: Made of steel plating.\nReliable, but requires\nhigh stamina.
column3: 由铁片组合而成的铠甲。\n战斗中可发挥稳健的防御力。\n只有体力大的人才能够装备。

column2: Strengthened with a\nparticular resin that\nmakes it very flexible.
column3: 用特殊的树脂做强化的铠甲。\n轻巧便于活动，而且其坚固\n程度远在钢铁铠甲之上。

column2: Beautifully-made armor\nof silver. Shields its\nwearer with holy magic.
column3: 有美丽装饰的白银铠甲。\n由于神的祝福的关系，\n可守护配戴者不受邪气伤害。

column2: Armor imbued with the\npower of flame. Can\nwithstand any attack.
column3: 得到烈火之力守护的铠甲。\n对所有攻击都有耐性。\n可因应所有种类的敌人。

column2: Bronze ring that fully\ndoubles the wearer's\nstrength.
column3: 青铜的戒指。施有让肌肉力量\n与潜在能力增加的魔法，所以，\n战斗中可成为一大助力。

column2: Magical brass ring.\nReduces all damage\nreceived by 1/2.
column3: 以黄铜做成的魔法戒指。\n可在周围设下结界，使\n来自外界的冲击减半。

column2: A ring of coral. Slows\nenemy movement to half\nnormal speed.
column3: 由珊瑚削下制成的戒指。\n借由操作时间的流动来\n使邪恶的魔动作迟钝。

column2: A holy ring. Purifies\nand restores the body\nto bring peace.
column3: 拥有神圣祝福的戒指。\n即使在邪气污染的场所\n也能带来治愈和安祥。

column2: Bloody-patterned ring\nthat taints and slowly\nkills its wearer.
column3: 以邪气染盖配戴者，\n毁灭身心的恐怖戒指。\n上面刻有鲜血般的花纹。

column2: A leather-bound book.\nWritten in a strange,\nunreadable language.
column3: 边缘饰有美丽花纹的皮面古文书\n。由于是以失传的古文字所书写\n，因此没有办法阅读。

column2: A master key made of\nbronze. Will open any\ntreasure chest.
column3: 以青铜打造的万能钥匙。\n遇到同种类的宝箱，\n通通都可以打开。

column2: A poorly-made rusty\niron key. Opens the\nprison gates.
column3: 做工粗糙、沉甸甸的铁钥匙。\n尖端部份有点生锈。\n可打开地下牢的门。

column2: A gorgeous key made of\ncrafted ruby and gold,\nwith a complex design.
column3: 有红宝石与黄金装饰的\n漂亮钥匙。插入的部份\n为弯曲复杂的形状。

column2: A fine ivory key\nfashioned from tiny,\ninterlocking shapes.
column3: 以淡淡的黄白色象牙制成的钥匙\n。边缘有条纹状的花纹\n做纤细的加工。

column2: A key of brilliantly\ndesigned green marble.\nShaped like a trident.
column3: 鲜艳的花纹装饰的翡翠色\n的大理石钥匙。插入的部分\n为类似三叉枪的形状。

column2: A key of shining blue\ncrystal, bearing a\nfamiliar-looking crest.
column3: 以青色发光的矿石制成的钥匙\n。刻有艾斯塔利亚的遗迹常见\n的不思议的纹章。

column2: A luminous crystal\nwith an exotic base.\nSparkles in the light.
column3: 以奇妙的装饰器具固定的\n大颗的闪亮的水晶。照到光时，\n中心像无数的星星一样灿烂发光

column2: Seed of an ancient\ntree, with a flavor\nsaid to rival all else.
column3: 存在于艾斯塔里亚的树木的种子\n柔软的果肉的中心部份，据说，\n比任何食物都要来得美味可口。

column2: Relic said to have\nguarded Zepik Village.\nIts sound is calming.
column3: 塞皮克村自古流传下来的宝物。\n据说一直保护着村子远离灾厄。\n振动时会发出清凉的响声。

column2: A silver harmonica\nwith a vibrant sound.\nSparkles majestically.
column3: 能发出美丽音色的\n白银制成的旧口琴。\n散发着纯白的光辉。

column2: Statue of an ancient\ndragon. Grants its\nbearer peace of mind.
column3: 以古代的翼龙为模形的青铜像\n具有消去持有者的存在气息的\n不思议的能力。

column2: A short magic wand.\nHas a design similar\nto Sara's Crystal.
column3: 魔导师可携带的短杖。\n看来与莎拉赠与的水晶\n出自同样的设计。

column2: An ancient monocle.\nThe lens seems to be\nin perfect condition.
column3: 看来使用已久、只剩一个镜片\n的老旧眼镜。似乎是用来阅读\n书籍，镜片本身没有度数。

column2: Heirloom of the Gemma\nfamily. Shines with a\npale and frigid light.
column3: 洁玛家代代相传下来的除魔的\n护身符。凛冽的青白色光辉与\n微微的冷气附着其上。

column2: A ruby set in gold.\nIts condition is\nvirtually flawless.
column3: 有黄金装饰的大颗红宝石。\n保存状态良好，珠子表面\n看不到明显的瑕疵。

column2: Sapphire-encrusted\nring inscribed with a\nmessage from its giver.
column3: 镶着蓝色宝石的戒指。\n内面似乎刻有赠送者的\n讯息。

column2: Gold necklace adorned\nwith countless small\nrubies and patterns.
column3: 黄金项链。镶嵌着许多\n小颗的红宝石。上面有\n凌乱的刮痕。

column2: Beautiful golden vase.\nHas a hole for some\nvariety of ornament.
column3: 纯金制的豪华台座。\n凹陷处可用来放置球体，\n但是用途不明。

column2: Medicine made from the\nRed Digitalis plant.\nHeals mind and body.
column3: 用红色赤毛地黄叶子熬制\n的药水。具有迅速回复\n身心不调的功能。

column2: Magic wing. Warps the\nuser to Minea. Some\nareas seal its power.
column3: 翅膀形状的魔法护身符。\n可瞬间跳跃到米内亚城镇。\n在强大结界下就无法使用。

column2: Ordinary iron hammer.\nFairly heavy. Could be\nused to break stone.
column3: 随处可见的铁制锤子。\n由于锤子本身很重，\n所以被用来敲碎岩石。

column2: Mirror that can freeze\na single moment. Will\nbreak with overuse.
column3: 可使映照的光景一时间静止。\n因为本身耐久性方面的极限，\n使用几次就会坏掉。

column2: Stone mask with inset\njade. Hides enemies,\nbut reveals secrets.
column3: 镶有翡翠的石头面具。\n戴上后会看不见有生命的物体，\n相对的，可以看见隐藏的渠道。

column2: Necklace of luminous\nblue crystal. Able to\nnullify evil traps.
column3: 以发出青色光辉的矿石打造的首\n饰。隐藏着强力的破邪力量，可\n以让邪恶的机关无效化。

column2: Potion blessed by a\npriest. Gives insight\non defeated enemies.
column3: 伟大的传道师调配出来的\n药水。可视战斗经验而\n得到相应的魔物的知识。

column2: Paper with several\nlines of an unreadable\nlanguage written on it.
column3: 一张纸上写着数行\n无法阅读的文章。

column3: 身体看起来没什么大碍。\n身体不舒服的话随时可以过来。

column2: Slaff says you'll be helping the\nmilitia. Don't know what to think\nof that, to be honest...
column3: 我从斯拉夫那里听说你的活跃事迹。\n老实说...一开始我还是挺担心的。\n现在你显得可靠稳重多了。

column2: ...Ahh, never mind me. Just keep an eye\non your health. That's all I ask!
column3: 我不打算多说废话。\n你就自己衡量自己体力，\n去试看看自己能力的极限吧。

column2: You're going to Minea? Well, just be\ncareful not to get yourself hurt again!
column3: 你要去米内亚吗？\n你的身体才刚好没多久，不要太勉强自己哦。

column2: You're looking healthy. How are you\nholding up?
column3: 啊，你看起来气色不错。\n身体状况如何啊？

column2: Hurt, again?! *sigh* Just 'cause you're\nyoung and dashing does NOT mean you're\ninvincible, okay?
column3: 你怎么又受伤了呢！\n不要仗着自己年轻就太乱来哦。

column2: Something terrible's been happening in\nMinea. I wonder if Barbado is next...
column3: 米内亚那里好像发生了大事情啊 。\n巴尔巴多不知道会不会有问题...

column2: But we do have Slaff's militia to\nprotect us here, so I think we'll\nbe okay. I hope so, anyway!
column3: 巴尔巴多\n有斯拉夫的自卫队在保护，\n一定不会有事的。

column2: You're looking troubled, Adol. Troubled\nand vulnerable...
column3: 亚特鲁，才多久没见，\n你的神情变得这么紧绷。\n...我想你是不是太辛苦了。

column2: Adol, be careful. If you get hurt, take\na moment to rest, okay?
column3: 亚特鲁，请你一定要保重啊。\n受伤的话不要太勉强，\n让身体休息也是很重要的。

column2: What's this? You're barely even\nscratched! Nurse Ayla should be\nable to handle this. Nurse!
column3: 什么啊，这点程度的小擦伤，\n根本用不着我动手嘛。

column2: Yes, sir! Now, Adol, please hold still.
column3: 好。\n来，亚特鲁。\n就这样不要动哦。

column2: I said, HOLD STILL!
column3: 不可以，请不要动！

column2: Eh? You're already fully healed!\nWhat's your angle...?
column3: ...啊？\n早就已经全好了嘛。

column2: Your injuries are fully healed.
column3: 你的伤早就已经好了哦。

column2: This is probably going to hurt.\nDisinfecting... Medicating...\nBandaging.... Praying, profusely...
column3: 哦，这个应该很痛吧。\n先消毒...上药...包上绷带...

column2: Ohh, it's just a scratch! Some salve\nwill do you just fine.
column3: 这只是小小的擦伤而已。\n涂点红药水就可以了。

column2: There we are. Try not to strain\nyourself. You need your strength!
column3: 瞧，这样就好了。\n以后不要太乱来啦。\n认清楚自己的力量也是必须的。

column2: What? I just treated you. I'm not senile\nyet, you know!
column3: 什么？\n刚刚才帮你治疗过的吧。\n你怎么可以比我先老呆呢。

column2: I'm sorry, we're all out of the Red\nDigitalis plant we need to make healing\npotions.
column3: 不好意思。\n药的原料，毛地黄\n已经没有了。

column2: Dr. Klaus in Minea should have some\nextra, though. You should go see him.
column3: 米内亚的克拉杰医院的话\n应该还有不少库存，\n你去那里帮我拿一些过来吧。

column2: Ah, you're going out again? Take care of\nyourself, Adol!
column3: 是吗？你又要出去了吗。\n记住，不能太勉强自己哦。

column2: Why, if it isn't Adol! You okay to be\nmoving around like that?
column3: 嗨，亚特鲁！\n你这样活动身体没问题吗？

column2: Every time I stopped by, you were sound\nasleep. You must have been exhausted!
column3: 我去病房找你时你都在睡觉。\n好像很疲累的样子。

column2: So...heard any murmurings overseas about\nEsteria?
column3: 对了，外面的人对艾斯塔里亚的事\n是什么样看法？

column2: I'd love to know what people are saying\nabout us!
column3: 说来听听怎么样？

column2: Adol told Slaff he'd heard the land was\ncursed.
column3: \n亚特鲁转述了人们称艾斯塔里亚\n是被诅咒的国度的说法。

column2: ...Cursed, huh? That's not really true,\nbut it's also not TOO far off.
column3: ...被诅咒的国度吗。\n虽然没完全说中，但也差不多了。

column2: Guess we can't count on any support from\nthe outside, if they think we're cursed\nover here. We've gotta take action!
column3: 果然还是不能寄望外面那些人。\n得靠自己来找出办法啊...

column2: Anyway, I don't know a whole lot, but\nI'll gladly answer any questions I can.\nAsk away!
column3: 我知道的不能代表全部，\n我只能说出所有我知道的部份，怎样？

column2: Hey, Adol. You're looking well! How are\nyou adjusting to Esterian life?
column3: 嗨，亚特鲁，你好像完全康复了嘛。\n还有什么想知道的吗？

column2: Anything on your mind?
column3: 你想了解什么？

column2: Barbado
column3: 巴尔巴多

column2: Esteria
column3: 艾斯塔里亚

column2: The Stormwall
column3: 岚之结界

column2: The Militia
column3: 自卫队

column2: Nothing
column3: 没什么特别的

column2: Barbado is the only port town in\nEsteria.
column3: 巴尔巴多是艾斯塔里亚唯一的港口都市。

column2: It used to just be a small fishing\nvillage until silver was discovered\nnearby. Then, it boomed overnight!
column3: 很久以前是普通的经济萧条的渔村。\n自从艾斯塔里亚开始产银之后，\n巴尔巴多就发展成贸易港口。

column2: ...But ever since that Stormwall\nshowed up, no ships can get in or\nout. Our exporting days are over!
column3: ...但是自从岚之结界出现之后，\n就没有船只能进来这里，银矿也无法出口了。

column2: So now, it's just a fishing village\nagain. For the time being, anyway.
column3: 于是又衰退成原来的渔村那个样子啦...

column2: At least everyone got some money from\nall the silver trade while it lasted,\nI guess!
column3: 唉，因银矿而繁荣的时候，\n每个人都为了赚钱而奔波劳累。\n出点状况休息一下也是不错。

column2: Esteria is a small island country.
column3: 艾斯塔里亚是个小小的岛国。

column2: There are only a few towns here.\nBarbado, the walled city of Minea,\nand Zepik Village in the mountains.
column3: 有人住的地方，不外就是\n这个巴尔巴多跟城壁都市米内亚、\n以及山麓的皮塞克村。

column2: Not long ago, there was also a town\ncalled Rastin, but it got wiped out\nby monsters after the mine closed.
column3: 不久之前还有拉斯提尼村。可是...\n受到银矿山封闭跟魔物来袭的打击，\n现在已经没人住在那里了...

column2: The place where I found you is called\nWhitehorn Beach.
column3: 你漂流到的地方\n被称为「白号角砂滩」。

column2: Mother-of-pearl pieces wash ashore\nthere. Great place for a stroll,\nsave for the monsters everywhere!
column3: 那个砂滩很漂亮，像铺了一层真珠贝的碎片一样\n纯白美丽。\n要不是有魔物出没，那里可是最适合散步的好地方。

column2: The walled city of Minea is to the\nnorth, beyond the plains. Good starting\npoint for any adventure.
column3: 从城镇向北走，到了草原再过去，\n是被城墙包围的都市，米内亚。\n如果有什么事要办，可以在这里先整顿好装备。

column2: What else... Oh, yeah! Darm Tower!\nEsteria's claim to fame-- sort of.
column3: 其他的嘛...\n艾斯塔里亚的地标，算是「达姆之塔」吧。

column2: What else... Oh, yeah! Darm Tower!\nEsteria's claim to fame. No doubt\nyou saw it on your way here.
column3: 还有就是，对了...\n艾斯塔里亚的地标，「达姆之塔」。你来这里的时候也有看见吧？

column2: It just seems to kiss the clouds,\ndoesn't it? On clear days, you can\nsee it all the way from Promalock!
column3: 那是高耸入天的巨大高塔，古代的遗迹。\n听说天气好的时候，从海的另一头的\n普罗马克港也可以看到它。

column2: There are other touristy spots, but\nthey've been infested with monsters\never since the Stormwall showed up.
column3: 唉，这儿旅游名胜不少，可惜...\n自从岚之结界出现以后，\n到处都是魔物在徘徊游荡。

column2: Damned thing really made life difficult\nfor us.
column3: 危险得要命，更不可能去到处逛逛了。

column2: It appeared...let's see, about six\nmonths or so ago.
column3: 那是...大约是半年前左右吧。

column2: The first storm started on a night when\nsome trade ships carrying silver set out\nfrom Barbado.
column3: 载着白银的商船从巴尔巴多港出港的夜晚，\n...发生了强烈的暴风雨。

column2: Buffeted by the storm, the ships were\nobliterated. Washed ashore on Whitehorn\nBeach the next morning.
column3: 船舶被暴风雨卷入，严重破损，\n漂流到白号角沙滩。

column2: We first thought it was an isolated\nincident, but the same fate's been\nmet by every other ship since.
column3: 一开始大家以为是倒霉的意外，\n可是从那天之后，所有船只\n都会遇到同样的事情...。

column2: That's how the Stormwall got its start.\nAnd now, we Esterians are pretty much\ntrapped here!
column3: 那就是岚之结界的开端。\n艾斯塔里亚的人被孤立岛上\n一步都无法离开。

column2: Most people have just kind of resigned\nthemselves to their fate. But me? I'm\ntoo stubborn for that!
column3: 现在几乎所有人都放弃了。\n...偏偏这就是我最不能容忍的事情。

column2: When the Stormwall appeared, monsters\ncame with it.
column3: 几乎与岚之结界发生的同一时期，\n艾斯塔里亚也开始出现魔物。

column2: That's what attacked you that day on the\nbeach. We call that particular species\n'Rheboll.'
column3: 攻击你的野狗也是其中一种。\n人们都称它为「利伯鲁」。

column2: Monsters first appeared on the road\nup to the mountain, but they began\nattacking the villages soon after.
column3: 魔物最初只是在山路上游荡，但是\n没多久就开始变得会攻击人居住的地方。

column2: Barbado in particular was hit pretty\nbadly.
column3: 我们巴尔巴多这里受害特别惨重。

column2: Minea seemed just as vulnerable, but\nthey've got that wall around them, so\nthey're much more secure.
column3: 米内亚那里的危险程度也不下于这里，但是\n那里有坚固的城墙守护，至少在里面可以安心生活。

column2: Zepik was spared, too, somehow.\nSupposedly kept the monsters out\nwith some kinda mystical bell.
column3: 塞皮克村的守护只有依靠栅栏，\n不知为什么，魔物就是不敢靠近。\n传说那是由于有不思议的铃在保护着村子的关系。

column2: We have nothing of the sort here,\nthough, so we have to take up arms\nand defend the town ourselves.
column3: ...我们这里什么都没有。\n自己的家乡只能靠自己来保护。\n你说是不是？

column2: You... You've got an iron will, man. You\nmay be just what we need!
column3: 不过你这个人也真是很鲁莽啊。

column2: The Stormwall has claimed so many\nlives...and it needs to stop!
column3: 竟然拿性命\n来挑战岚之结界...

column2: I assume you're looking to travel all\nthroughout Esteria, no?
column3: 你该不会在打着\n环游艾斯塔里亚各地\n的危险主意吧？

column2: That's...a really bad idea. You'll\nbe eaten by monsters for sure. No\ngood can come of it!
column3: 我劝你...最好不要。\n被魔物攻击的下场是很惨的。

column2: ...Why not join the town militia\ninstead? You've sure got the guts\nfor it!
column3: ...反倒是，你看怎样？\n想不想加入我们的自卫队？\n我看你也是很有骨气的人...

column2: Adol explained that he wanted to\nconfirm Esteria's current state\nwith his own eyes.
column3: \n亚特鲁表明自己\n到各地确认实际情况的想法。

column2: ...Yeah, I figured. I know your type.\nI doubt I could ever change your mind.
column3: ...我懂了。\n唉，原来你已经打定主意了啊。

column2: You're a wild one, for sure. Takes\nnothing short of a miracle to make\nit through the Stormwall alive.
column3: 你真的很有胆量。\n竟然可以越过岚之结界，\n真的是奇迹啊。

column2: This...is my place. I know that. But\nit's not yours. No, destiny's got bigger\nthings in mind for you, definitely!
column3: 这是我的直觉...我觉得\n可能有神奇的命运在等待着你。

column2: Anyway, when you leave here, go north.\nWe're just a hop, skip and a jump away\nfrom #02Minea.
column3: ...首先你就离开巴尔巴多，一路向北走。\n走一阵子以后，#02应该可以看到米内亚#00的城壁。

column2: Minea is Esteria's largest city. You're\nsure to find some useful information\nthere.
column3: 米内亚是艾斯塔里亚最大的城市。\n你一定可以在那里打听到你想知道的消息。

column2: Oh, yeah...and take this with you.
column3: 对了...你拿这个走吧。

column2: Consider it a parting gift. All of us\nmilitants carry these. They're small,\nbut they get the job done!
column3: 算是我送给你的践别礼。\n那是我们自卫队用的东西，\n体积不大，但是很好使用。

column2: Haven't got much in the way of armor,\nbut there's a good shop for that in\nMinea. Be sure to stop by when you can!
column3: 至于防具，很遗憾，目前没有多的。。\n米内亚那里有防具专卖店，\n你可以等赚到钱以后去采购。

column2: ...Take care. And if you come around\nagain, drop in!
column3: ...那就这样啦。\n要偶尔过来露个脸哦。

column2: Take care, Adol. Be sure to stop by if\nyou're ever in town again!
column3: 保重啦，亚特鲁。\n经过巴尔巴多的时候要来露个脸哦。

column2: All right. Well, you be sure to come\nback sometime!
column3: 是吗，下次还要再来哦。

column2: Adol... It's pretty cold of you to leave\nwithout even saying goodbye.
column3: 亚特鲁...\n你这样闷不吭声离开巴尔巴多\n未免太见外了吧。

column2: Still, you're feeling better, so I'll\noverlook it...this time.
column3: 不过看到你人好好的，\n我就安心了。

column2: Next time, though, you'd better drop in\nbefore you go, or I'll bust you up!
column3: 偶尔也来我这里露个脸嘛。

column2: You've been all over Esteria, it seems.\nAnything new to report?
column3: 听说你走遍了艾斯塔里亚各地。\n怎样，有什么特别的进展吗？

column2: Hey, you seem well. How's Esteria\nlooking?
column3: 嗨，你看起来气色不错啊。\n怎样，艾斯塔里亚的情况如何？

column2: If there's ever anything troubling you,\nfeel free to come on by.
column3: 有什么困难的话，随时可以来找我。\n说不定我可以帮上一点忙。

column2: Well, now, if it isn't Adol! So what's\nthe story? Learn anything out there?
column3: 嗨，这不是亚特鲁吗。\n有发生什么特殊的事件吗？

column2: What's wrong? You look positively\ndrained! Did something happen to\nyou?
column3: 怎么了吗，你的表情这么严肃...。\n到底发生什么事情了？

column2: Adol told Slaff about the monsters\nhe'd been fighting, and the events\nleading up to these battles.
column3: \n亚特鲁把巨大魔物的出现等等\n一连串发生的事都告诉了斯拉夫。

column2: Yeah, my men tell me something is\ndefinitely happening to Minea...and\nwhatever it is, it's no good at all!
column3: 我听队里的人说了，\n米内亚那里好像发生大事了。

column2: Do you know anything more specific about\nwhat's going on out there, Adol?
column3: 亚特鲁...\n你知道详情的话，\n拜托你就告诉我吧！

column2: Adol told Slaff all about the recent\nchain of events.
column3: \n亚特鲁对斯拉夫\n说了发生的一连串的事件。

column2: He explained that he was searching\nfor the Books of Ys, and told of\nhis odd experience in the shrine.
column3: \n包括他在寻找『伊苏之书』、\n以及在神殿的不思议的体验...

column2: Wow. It's like some kind of fairy tale!
column3: 嗯...\n真是有够···这是什么离谱的世界啊。

column2: First the Stormwall, now this...\nAre we in a magical fantasy land,\nbuilt for someone's amusement?!
column3: 还有那个岚之结界...\n这个国家到底是出了什么状况啊！

column2: Ehh, either way... You've got a\nheaping helping of destiny on your\nplate, Adol. Eat up, I say!
column3: 不过...我的直觉果然没错。\n你的命运果然是很不可思议啊。

column2: ...Actually, will you follow me for a\nmoment?
column3: ...亚特鲁，你有时间吗？\n麻烦跟我来一下。

column2: Here. Take this sword with\nyou.
column3: 亚特鲁，你收下这把剑吧。

column2: I found it while patrolling\nat Whitehorn Beach, six\nmonths ago.
column3: ...这是半年前\n巡逻白号角砂滩的时候\n在海滩上捡到的。

column2: Probably from a trade ship capsized\nby the Stormwall. Which means they\nwon't miss it, so don't feel bad!
column3: 我想应该是被岚之结界打沉的\n商船上的东西吧。

column2: I think it came from one of the\ncountries in the east. The curved\nblade gives it a distinctive feel.
column3: 看起来像是来自东方的的刀剑。\n弯曲的刀刃非常锋利，不过\n这个用起来难度很高。

column2: I think you'll make good use of it.\nHope it comes in handy fighting all\nthose monsters!
column3: 我想以你的能力应该可以使用吧。\n希望它在跟魔物的战斗中能够派上用场。

column2: Ha... It's weird, you know? Seeing\nthat determined look in your eyes,\nI almost want to go with you...
column3: 呵呵...这感觉还真奇怪。\n看到你积极进取的生命态度，\n不知不觉就想要为你加油。

column2: Ah, well. I'll see you later, man.\nIf you need anything else, don't\nyou hesitate to swing by!
column3: ...那么就这样啦。\n有事的话再到仓库来找我。

column2: Keep at it, Adol. You just might be able\nto solve the mysteries of this land!
column3: 亚特鲁，加油啊。\n搞不好你可以为大家解开\n被诅咒的艾斯塔里亚的谜题！

column2: Adol told Slaff that he was headed to\nDarm Tower.
column3: \n亚特鲁告诉斯拉夫\n自己即将进入达姆之塔的打算。

column2: ...I see. You're going to the Devil's\nTower, are you?
column3: ...是吗。\n你要去那座『恶魔之塔』...

column2: Well...you look up to the task, at\nleast. Much better than when you\nfirst washed ashore, at any rate!
column3: 不过...亚特鲁。\n你现在的神情非常的棒。\n嗯，真的...就像变了个人一样。

column2: Thought you were just some headstrong\nkid back then. But I know better now!
column3: 一开始我还以为你只是个普通的\n血气方刚的少年而已...\n现在你的眼睛沉静清澈，没有丝毫的迷惑。

column2: I guess I've said all I can. Only thing\nleft to do is wish you luck!
column3: 我已经没有什么建议可以给你了。

column2: You should go and find us the truth\nbehind all these calamities. I know\nyou can do it.
column3: 你就用那双眼睛去好好的看清楚\n艾斯塔里亚发生的异变的真相吧。

column2: Just be sure you come back alive...\nor I'll kill you!
column3: 你一定...一定要回来哦！

column2: I guess I've said all I can. Only thing\nleft to do is wish you luck!
column3: 我已经没有什么建议可以给你了。

column2: You should go and find us the truth\nbehind all these calamities. I know\nyou can do it.
column3: 你就用那双眼睛去好好的看清楚\n艾斯塔里亚发生的异变的真相吧。

column2: Just be sure you come back alive...\nor I'll kill you!
column3: 你一定...一定要回来哦！

column2: Such stunning red hair...\nYou must be Adol, no? Doctor\nBludo told me all about you.
column3: 那个红头发...\n我知道了！你就是亚特鲁君对吧？\n我听布鲁多医生说了。

column2: As you can see, we're on a bit of a\nbreak right now. The Stormwall's not\nconducive to tourism, after all!
column3: 如你所见，现在暂时停止营业。\n因为岚之结界的关系，\n船只都不来了...

column2: I can get you something to\ndrink anyway, though, if\nyou'd like. What say you?
column3: 要不要喝一杯再走？

column2: It's nice and quiet here with no\ncustomers, but it does start to\ntake its toll after a time.
column3: 没有客人是很轻松啦，\n问题就是清闲过头了...

column2: How was Minea? If not for the\nmonsters, we could go spread our\nwings and explore a little, easily.
column3: 米内亚的情况怎么样？\n没有魔物的话，\n我早就想要去那里玩了。

column2: I'm so very bored... If you should\nfind anything of interest, please,\nbe sure to tell me all about it!
column3: 啊...好闲啊。\n有什么趣闻的话，\n一定要告诉我哦。

column2: Have you been to Orman's\nBar in Minea? I hear it's\ndoing just as well as ever!
column3: 你去过米内亚城内的\n欧曼酒馆了吗？\n听说那里还是老样子生意兴隆啊...。

column2: I envy the lucky inlander! Before\nthe Stormwall, we were doing just\nas well, thanks to all the traders.
column3: 我真是羡慕欧曼唷。\n我们在岚之结界发生以前\n生意好的程度可是不下于他们呢...

column2:
You're the one that Slaff
rescued, aren't you? Fine
red hair like yours is
certainly a rarity here.
column3:
被斯拉夫救起的人
就是你吗？
你这头醒目的红头发
确实不常见。

column2: So you're Adol... Well,\nit's good to finally meet\nyou.
column3: 亚特鲁吗...\n好吧，请多多指教。

column2: Hmm? What's wrong? Did\nyou need something?
column3: 嗯？怎么啦？\n找我有什么事吗？

column2:
One of our jobs is to
escort people between
places like Minea and
Zepik Village.
column3: 自卫队的工作之一\n是护送本地人到\n米内亚或塞皮克村...

column2:
The monsters tend to avoid me, yet
always attack the villagers I'm
escorting, from behind, without
fail. Cunning bastards...
column3:
有时候魔物偏偏不找我，
专挑后面被护送的人，
找弱的人下手。
都是堆狡滑到令人害怕的家伙。

column2:
I guess the only way to
protect others is by
putting yourself between
them and the enemy.
column3: 保护他人的要诀是\n随时保持在敌人与自己人中间的那个位置。

column2:
They're wily ones, though. When
you're outside the town, be sure
you don't let your guard down for
even a single instant!
column3: 总之那些家伙很狡滑就对了。\n到了城镇以外的地方，绝不能露出半点破绽。

column2:
We watch the surrounding area from
here. That way, if the demons try
to mount an attack, we can see them
coming and get ready for it.
column3: 从这里可以监视城外的情况。\n魔物妄图入侵时，\n一眼就看出来了。

column2:
I doubt they'll attack
during the day, of course,
but 'tis better to be safe
than sorry...you know?
column3: 我想那些魔物\n是不大可能大白天就来偷袭，不过...\n总之绝不以大意轻敌。

column2:
It's tedious work, but
SOMEBODY has to keep
watch over the city. And
that somebody is me!
column3: 虽然无聊，但是为了城里的安全，\n总得有人来做这份工作嘛。\n...片刻都不能大意哦。

column2:
The monsters pretty much never hit
us here. But the fact remains, they
easily COULD. You can never tell
what they're thinking!
column3:
最近没有发生魔物的袭击。
可是只要我们一放松，
它们又会看准机会打过来...
就好像背后有人在操纵一样。

column2:
Our little port town isn't behind
walls like Minea, so it falls on us
to keep the place safe. In a sense,
it's like WE'RE Barbado's walls.
column3: 本地没有像米内亚那样的城墙，\n所以就得靠我们的自卫队来保护了。

column2: I came here because I heard\nI could make a tidy profit\nin the local silver trade.
column3: 唉，我是听说这里的银矿很赚钱，\n才专程跑来这个边境地带的说。

column2: Now I just want to go home. Damned\nStormwall! May its stormy progeny\nall suffer uncomfortable bloating!
column3: 好想赶快回大陆哦。\n要不是有可恨的什么结界...

column2: You're from the mainland\nas well, aren't you? What\nbrings you to Esteria?
column3: 你也是从大陆来的人吧？\n你是来艾斯塔里亚做什么的呀？

column2: Do you know Pim, the barterer?\nHe came here around the same\ntime I did.
column3: 你知道米内亚的商人皮姆吗\n那家伙跟我差不多同一时候\n来艾斯塔里亚的。

column2: He's a shady one. Has to be, though,\nworkin' a place like that. Gotta\ncheck your scruples at the door.
column3:
听说他在那里很吃得开，
想也知道他背地里不知干了多少肮脏事。
要不然，
开交换所怎么可能赚钱呢。

column2: At any rate, there's no way back to\nthe mainland right now. So I'm stuck\nhere, selling crap to the locals!
column3: 啊...到底有没有\n可以让我们回去大陆的方法呢...

column2:
At one time, Barbado was swimming
in traders like my husband. But
they all tried to go home, and got
swallowed up by the storms.
column3:
以前巴尔巴多
还有很多像我们一样的商人。
大家搭船想逃离这里，
结果都被暴风雨吞没...

column2:
I'm just grateful to have
my family here with me,
though. That's enough to
keep me happy.
column3: 我是因为携家带眷的关系，\n行动慢人一步，没想到\n反而因此保住了一命。

column2: You're going to Minea, no?\nBe careful of the monsters\nwandering the plains.
column3: 你要去米内亚？\n那你得小心草原上的魔物哦。

column2:
My husband does prattle on, doesn't
he? Maybe if he'd join the militia,
or take up fishing, he could work
out some of his anxiety.
column3:
我老公真是的，
就只会在那里怨天尤人...
他要嘛加入自卫队，要嘛去捕鱼
活动活动身体都好。

column2: I need to look for\nsomething I can do to\nhelp around here, myself!
column3: 我也去找找看有没有我能做的\n对镇上有益的事情...

column2:
My daddy always talks about
leaving Esteria. But why
would I leave, when I have
so many good friends here?
column3: 爸爸经常在说要离开这个国家。\n可是我一点也不想回去。\n我好不容易在这里交了朋友...。

column2: Ahhh... I think I'm gonna\ngo play with my friend\nnext door!
column3: 啊，我去找邻居的小孩玩。

column2: My son and his wife live\nin Minea.
column3: 我儿子跟媳妇\n都住在米内亚城内。

column2:
They keep asking me to go live with
them...but they must be joking! This
is my home. I could never leave
here, no matter what the danger!
column3:
他们要我一起去住...
开什么玩笑，
我是打死、
都不会想离开这里的。

column2: At my age, I've no intention of\nfinding a new home.
column3: 都活到这个年纪了，我是不可能\n离开这住惯了的老家的。

column2: I was born and raised here.
column3: 我可是在这里出生、\n在这村长大的呀。

column2: I hope my son and his wife\nare doing well in Minea.
column3: 我那住在米内亚的\n儿子跟媳妇不知道好不好...

column2:
I would like to be able to sneak
away to see my grandchild...but
traveling these monster-infested
roads is far too dangerous!
column3: 我的孙子正值淘气的年纪，\n没有一直在旁看着...\n搞不好会偷溜出城去呀。真是令人担心。

column2: I'm sure my family's doing\nwell...but I still worry\nabout my dear grandchild.
column3: 希望他们都身体健康。\n...只是，对孙子的事我还是不大放心。

column2: Slaff is working hard to keep\nthe town safe...but in the end,\nhe may just be kidding himself.
column3: 虽然斯拉夫常常在训练，\n可是临时抱佛脚也没用啊...

column2:
Rather than live in fear of a
monster attack, wouldn't it be
better for everyone in Barbado
to move to Minea?
column3: 与其在魔物入侵的威胁下生活，\n还不如乾脆全巴尔巴多的人\n都移民到米内亚去会比较好吧？

column2: However hard we try, we're\nsimply no match for the monsters.\nIf they attack us, we're done for!
column3: 不管再怎样努力练功，\n我看都很难打赢魔物...

column2:
You should try to talk some
sense into that stubborn fool.
With mesmerizing hair like yours,
maybe he'd listen!
column3: 你也是同样的想法对吧？

column2: You went to Minea? Are you daft?!\nThere are monsters everywhere!
column3: 你说你去过米内亚了？\n你...你不怕魔物吗？

column2: There was once a village near the\nmine, but I hear it was razed to\nthe ground by the monsters.
column3: 矿山附近的村子\n就是被魔物消灭的啊...

column2: How is that you and Slaff can\nbe such brave men? Do you just\neat a lot of fiber, or what?!
column3: 不管是你还是斯拉夫...\n真搞不懂为什么你们能够那么有信心？

column2:
This is the town where I was
born and raised. It's my home!
To even consider leaving this
place...
column3: 这里是我出生、成长的地方...\n可能的话我不想移民到外地去。

column2:
But my child's safety is
paramount. So perhaps
Minea, with its city wall,
really is the place to be!
column3: 但是为了家里的孩子...\n或许住在有城墙的米内亚\n会比较安全吧？

column2:
Our Danny certainly wants to go to
Minea. He's already tried to make
the journey, in fact...with the
neighbor's little girl in tow!
column3: 我儿子真是的，\n竟然想带着邻居家的女孩\n到米内亚去。

column2:
We always warn them how dangerous
it is outside the town... Well,
let me tell you, they got what was
coming to them!
column3: 再三跟他叮咛过\n城外面很危险的...。\n等他回家我一定要好好的骂他一顿。

column2: Hey Mister, did you come\nfrom the mainland? Isn't\nthe Stormwall really neato?!
column3: 大哥哥你是从外面来的吗？\n岚之结界是不是很可怕呀？

column2:
I hope it stays forever! If
it ever goes away, the girl
next door will have to leave
with her family.
column3: 我比较希望结界不要消失。\n消失的话，邻居家的女孩就得跟家里的人\n搭船回去家乡了。

column2: Three cheers for the Stormwall!\nIt's what got me my girlfriend!
column3: ...结界\n要是不会消失就好了...

column2: These little critters are called\npikkards. They've been raised as\nlivestock here for generations.
column3: 这只叫做皮卡多。\n自古以来这个国家的人所饲养的家畜。

column2:
Their meat is absolutely delicious,
but they're real easy prey for
monsters. So we raise 'em here,
where nothing can hurt 'em but us!
column3: 肉质非常棒，美味极了。\n因为会成为魔物的猎物，\n所以就这样圈在城里面养了。

column2: Since the ships are all grounded,\nthere's no work to be had at the\nharbor anymore.
column3: 自从船只不能通航以后，\n港口的工作机会就全部没了。

column2:
I'd been hoping to branch out
into the silver trade...but
that didn't exactly work out
either. Bad luck, all around!
column3: 之前我们都是靠银矿交易在过活的，\n偏偏在打算扩大营业的时候...。\n...太遗憾了。

column2: *sigh* Guess it's a fisherman's\nlife for me!
column3: 啊，到底该怎么办呢。\n...难道只剩捕鱼一途了吗。\n

column2: Watch out for the blue-headed\ndemons out in the field. Be\ncareless, and you'll be dead.
column3: 在草原要注意青脑袋的魔物。\n还没有习惯作战之前，\n很难把它打伤。

column2:
You're only human, after all.
If you're not sure about your
chances for survival...then
run away! Run like the wind!
column3: 留得青山在不怕没柴烧，\n见情况不妙的时候别意气用事，赶快逃。

column2:
Slaff should ease up a bit,
and stop worrying. If things
get hectic, everyone here can
always just move to Minea.
column3:
斯拉夫也真是的，
何必那么紧张呢。
情况不妙时，大家全部
逃到米内亚避难就好了嘛。

column2:
I love this town...but would I die
for it? Hell no! Rastin's villagers
made that mistake, and I do NOT
intend to end up like they did!
column3: 我是在这地方住习惯了啦，不过...\n我可不想步上拉斯提尼村的后尘。

column2: Word on the street is that\nMinea's having a real problem\nwith thieves these days...
column3: 不过现在谣传米内亚\n正饱受盗贼之害...

column2: Thieves and monsters...\nImagine having to contend\nwith both at the same time!
column3: 魔物跟盗贼吗...\n任何一边都很麻烦呀...

column2:
Things were great six months
ago. Huge trade ships were
coming in constantly, and
Barbado was flourishing.
column3: 半年前还是那么美好的呀...\n大商船接二连三的开来，\n那时巴尔巴多港可是热闹极了。

column2: But these days, all we do is\nfish, fish, fish. I yearn for\nthe way things were...
column3: 如今却成了普通的渔村...\n真怀念那个时候啊。

column2:
*sigh* I'm not sure this town can
survive on fishing alone. It's only
been six months, and we're already
in a pretty bad way...
column3: 呼...\n短短半年就变成原来的渔村...\n感觉好空虚啊。

column2:
I wonder what caused the
Stormwall... If we knew
that, we might be able to
get rid of it!
column3: 岚之结界的形成原因是什么呢？\n我想要是查得出来，\n这个国家就能恢复原来的样子了。

column2: Six months ago, monsters started\nshowing up on the north road.
column3: 大约半年前，北边的街道\n开始有魔物出没。

column2:
As a result, I haven't seen
my friends in Minea for quite
some time. I wonder how they're
doing these days...
column3: 害我有好一阵子都没办法\n去见米内亚的朋友。\n他们现在不知道怎么样了...

column2: Minea's protected by city walls,\nso it's a safer place to be.
column3: 米内亚有坚固的城墙，\n我想是比这里安全。

column2: On the other hand, I hear they\nhave some serious crime problems\nthere. Lots of thievery...
column3: 不过现在又有风声说\n米内亚频频遭到盗贼骚扰...

column2: You know what? I trust our militia.\nThey look after us, Minea, and even\nZepik! They're good people.
column3: 还是自卫队比较可靠啊。\n会护送民众到\n米内亚或塞皮克村。

column2: But we can't just take them for\ngranted. I mean, you just never\nknow, right?
column3: 不过也不能突然就开口要他们帮忙。\n那样做不大好吧？

column2:
But just between you and me...
I feel like the men here tend to
perpetuate violence just to satisfy
their own sense of machismo!
column3: 这话我只跟你说哦...\n你不觉得看到男人\n为自己冒生命危险...

column2:
Though, I dunno, I actually...kinda
like that! Big, strong, supple men
fighting to keep me from harm...
It's really pretty sexy!
column3: 内心有点高兴吗。

column2: Well, now, who might you be?
column3: 哦，你不是本地人哦...

column2: I see, so you're the young man that\nDr. Bludo has been looking after...\nYou must've been through a lot!
column3: 是吗，原来你是被送去布鲁多医生\n那里的年轻人啊...\n发生海难真是不幸啊

column2: But you're looking very well.\nThat's Bludo for you!
column3: 不过看你好像很健康的样子，\n这应该是布鲁多医生的治疗的功劳吧。

column2:
There's a fortuneteller who
lives in #02Minea#00, to the north.
She predicted the Stormwall,
the monsters...everything!
column3: 北#02米内亚街道#00的占卜师\n对于岚之结界与魔物的出现，\n好像做过很多预言的样子...

column2:
If there's something you need to
know, you should go visit her.
She'll answer every question you
could possibly have!
column3: 如果你有什么事情想要知道，\n去拜访一下那位占卜师怎样？

column2: ...Once you're feeling up to it,\nthat is. Don't want your wounds\nreopening, after all!
column3: 不过那是等你的\n身体恢复过来再说的事了。

column2:
In the ruins past Zepik Village,
there's a row of statues depicting
a winged goddess. Their beauty is
like nothing else I've ever seen.
column3:
塞皮克村前面的神殿遗迹里面，
有背上长翅膀的女神像排列在那里。
那美丽的样子啊，
绝非世间所有。

column2:
Actually, though...that shrine is
awfully cramped inside, considering
how big it looks from the outside.
Or maybe I'm just misremembering!
column3: 以神殿的大小来说，\n里面却出人意料的狭窄。\n不过这是很久以前的事了，我也记得不是很清楚。

column2: I've been fishing here for\nas long as I can remember...
column3: 我从很久以前开始\n就一直在这里靠捕渔为生...

column2:
Since the Stormwall appeared,
my catch has been consistently
bigger than ever. I believe one
would call that a mixed blessing!
column3: 岚之结界发生以后\n渔获反而变多了。\n还真是讽刺啊。

column2: It's totally wiped out our\ntrade, but hey, at least we're\nnot starving, right?
column3: 岚之结界导致\n大家生意都做不成了。不过\n幸好还可以捕鱼，至少不用担心饿死。

column2: Whichever way you look\nat it, Barbado always was\njust a fishing village.
column3: 不管世事如何变化，\n巴尔巴多这儿\n本来就是一个渔村了嘛。

column2: Is it really so bad to\nreturn to the old ways?
column3: 乾脆就保持这样，\n回到过去的生活方式也不错？

column2: If only I were bigger...
column3: 我要是\n再长大一点就好了。

column2: I'd join the militia, and wipe\nout all the monsters with my\nawe-inspiring legendary blade!
column3: 这样我就能加入自卫队，\n很帅气的拿剑\n把那些魔物通通赶跑。

column2: Whenever we want to go to\nMinea and play, the woman\nnext door always stops us.
column3: 我想去米内亚玩，可是被\n邻居家的阿姨给阻止。

column2: She says it's because the demons\nmight get us. I say, let 'em try!\nWe'll beat 'em black and blue!
column3: 说是担心会碰到魔物。\n好无聊哦...

column2: Before the Stormwall appeared,\nthis bar was always packed.
column3: 岚之结界发生前，\n我们酒馆的生意可是好的要命呢。

column2: I can handle being poor...\nI just really hate being\nbored all the time!
column3: 我觉得穷一点也无所谓，只是...\n我讨厌这种死气沉沉的气氛。

column2: I can't just sit around. Maybe\nI should ask Slaff to let me\njoin the militia...
column3: 老是发呆也不是办法，\n我也去拜托斯拉夫，\n加入自卫队好了。

column2: But, yeah, that'd be about as\nuseful as punching a wall!
column3: 斯拉夫！

column2: If I told him I wanted to join,\nhe'd be all like, 'The militia\nis NOT FOR KIDS!'
column3: 我说我想加入自卫队\n他居然说『这里不收儿童』！

column2: But he seems nice...and\nI guess he's right.
column3: 平时他为人很好、值得信赖，\n偏偏就是这方面太顽固。

column2: By the way, how old are you?
column3: 对了，请问你几岁啊？

column2: Huh? You're seventeen? That's\nonly a year older than me!
column3: 咦...17岁？\n跟我只差一岁嘛！

column2: Grrr... If he'll let you\nin, then why not me?!
column3: 呜，为什么你的话可以，\n我的话就不行呢！

column2: Grrr... If he'll let you\nin, then why not me?!
column3: 呜，为什么你的话可以，\n我的话就不行呢！

column2: My hometown is in a far-\noff northern land.
column3: 我的故乡在很远很远的北方。

column2: I wonder if my sister's\ndoing well. Been a long\ntime since I've seen her...
column3: ...家乡的姐姐不知道怎么样呢。

column2:
*Yawn* Nope, there's just
nothing to do! Bored bored
bored bored bored I am so
very bored!
column3: 啊~<1-！闲死了。\n我快无聊死了！

column2: I am Reah, a poet and troubadour. My\npriceless #02Silver Harmonica#00 has been\nstolen, and I don't know what to do!
column3: 我是诗人，我叫蕾雅。\n我最珍爱的#02银之口琴#00\n不知道被谁给夺走...

column2: I value it nearly as much as my own\nlife...
column3: 少了那个口琴...我...\n我真的...不知道该怎么办了...

column2: Up until now, I've been traveling\nin search of that perfect melody.
column3: 为了追求某个旋律...\n我一直旅行到现在。

column2: I play ancient songs lost to the\nsands of time, dug from the depths\nof Esteria's long-forgotten past.
column3: 那是艾斯塔里亚所失去的，\n久远以前...未知的年代的古老的旋律。

column2: But, without my Silver Harmonica,\nI can play nary a single note...

column3: 我的名字叫多尼斯。

column2: Somewhere in this general area, I\nlost a beautiful sapphire ring I'd\npurchased as a gift for my wife.
column3: 我用辛苦存下来的私房钱\n买了准备送给老婆当礼物\n的蓝宝石戒指不见了。

column2: Without it, I feel as if I can't\neven face her. Damnable thieves!\nI'll wager this is their doing!
column3: 这样子我怎么回家嘛...\n可恶，这一定是\n那些盗贼干的好事。

column2: Without it, I feel as if I can't\neven face her. Damnable thieves!\nI'll wager this is their doing!
column3: 这样子我怎么回家嘛...\n可恶，这一定是\n那些盗贼干的好事

column2: Ohh, whatever shall I do? I can't\ngo home without that ring!
column3: 啊...\n我该怎么办。\n照不到戒指叫我怎么回家嘛...

column2: What the hell is wrong with those\nthieves? Why can't they rob from\nthe rich and give to the poor?!
column3: 那些的盗贼偷我这种平民小老百姓的戒指\n真是太没天良了。

column2: (hic) Oy, Adol... Why so serious?\nLet's shake what we got! (hic)
column3: ...(打嗝)...嗨，亚特鲁。\n怎么啦？一脸衰相的做什么。来啦，咱们一起狂欢。\n(打嗝)。

column2: Hey now, Donis, I think you've had\nenough. Adol, back me up, will you?
column3: 喂，多尼斯。你喝太多酒了。\n喂，亚特鲁。你能不能帮帮我这个忙呀？

column2: ...I don't care...about anything\nanymore... Without that ring...\nI'm doooooooomed...
column3: ......。\n啊...没有戒指的话...我实在是...。

column2: Ahh... How am I ever gonna\nexplain this to my wife?!
column3: 啊。\n我要怎么向我老婆交代呢。

column2: Man, Donis is sure down in the\ndumps. Adol, is there anything\nyou can do for him?
column3: 真是，多尼斯这家伙也有够麻烦的。\n怎样，亚特鲁。你看你能不能帮他一下呢？

column2: Boy, are you ever heartless...
column3: 什么嘛，大哥你也太无情了吧...。

column2: ...You found my ring at the pawn\nshop? And you bought it back?!
column3: 你在交换所找到戒指了？\n并且你还把它买回来了？

column2: Th-thank you so much... Now I can\nactually face my wife again!
column3: 啊，感激不尽...\n这么一来我就有脸面对我老婆了。

column2: I can't offer you much in return,\nbut...you have no idea what this\nmeans to me...so please, take this.
column3: 这个谢礼代表我小小的心意。\n请你无论如何一定要收下！

column2: Adol received#02 1500 Gold.
My ring's been found, everyone!\nA round of drinks, on me!
column3: 为了庆祝找到戒指，\n再乾一杯吧！

column2: Hey, Adol. I finally went home, and\ngave that ring to my wife. Thank\nyou again for saving my hide.
column3: 嗨，亚特鲁。\n我把戒指拿给我老婆了。\n谢谢你，多亏有你的帮忙。

column2: Uuuughh... I think I drank too\nmuch, though... I don't feel so\ngood...
column3: 唔~。\n酒有点喝多了。想吐...呜。

column2: Huh...? The boss is looking for\nme? Yikes! Guess I'd better get\nback to work, then!
column3: 什么？呃...\n老大一直在找我？\n...看来我该回去了。

column2: Hey, you! Stop right there!
column3: 喂！停下来！

column2: Kids like you should stay\nindoors! It's dangerous out\nhere! Where are your parents?!
column3: 小孩子不可以出去外面。\n爸爸妈妈没有这样跟你说吗？

column2: ...Well, you don't look\nTHAT young, I guess...
Sorry. I don't mean\nto be a nag.
column3: 抱歉，失礼了。

column2: Shouldn't be addressing\nyou like you're 3 years\nold or something.
column3: 真的很不好意思，\n不小心把你当成小孩子。

column2: Still, can't say I\nrecognize you. Are\nyou from Barbado?
column3: 没见过你哦，你是从巴尔巴多来的吗？

column2:
The lands outside are
teeming with monsters.
You'd be better off
in Minea.
column3: 前方出没的魔物很多，\n不要冒险，进到米内亚城内比较安全。

column2:
My big brother was a miner,
but he got attacked by a
monster in one of the tunnels,
and barely made it out alive.
column3:
我的哥哥以前
是在矿山工作的。
他被矿坑深处出现的魔物攻击，
受了好严重的伤呢。

column2: He tried to fight back using\nhis pickaxe, but it didn't\nwork too well.
column3: 他说他用十字镐应战，\n结果一点都不管用。

column2: Still, he made it!\nAnd that's what really\ncounts, right?
column3: 他说能保住一命\n就该庆幸了。

column2:
...But he was the strongest man
here. And if the strongest man
here can't fight back against
the monsters...then who can...?
column3: 但哥哥还是我们那里力气最大的人呢...。\n如果连最强壮的人都无法对抗魔物...\n那还能有谁...

column2: I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
Her word games are way
too hard, though. She's
a grown-up, so I wish
she'd cut me a break!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐
玩接龙游戏太厉害了。
他是大人，
应该要让我一点的才对。

column2: I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
She's really bad at word
games. She can only beat
people when she cheats,
just like my brother!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐
玩接龙玩得好差劲哦。
除非像我哥哥一样作弊，
不然她是赢不了的。

column2: I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
She's really good at
rock-paper-scissors.
She should just let me
win every once in a while!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐、
猜拳太厉害了。
她是大人，
应该让我一点的。

column2: I've been playing with Reah.
column3: 我在跟蕾雅姐姐玩。

column2:
She's really bad at rock-
paper-scissors. She can
only beat me when she
cheats, like my brother!
column3:
蕾雅姐姐
猜拳好弱哦。
除非像我哥哥一样作弊，
不然她是赢不了的。

column2:
Before the monsters showed up,
we used to always play under
the huge tree in the plains...
but we can't do that now.
column3: 魔物到处出没之前，\n原野北边的那棵大树底下，\n本来是我们大家游玩的地方...。

column2: The grownups won't let\nus go outside the city\nwalls anymore.
column3: 大人叫我们不可以出去外面，\n所以最近就没有去了。

column2:
If I could just climb that
tree ONE TIME, I'd never
need to climb another one
ever again!
column3: 成功爬上那棵树的人，\n对其他的树根本就不会放在眼里。

column2: My grandpa often tells me\nEsterian fairy tales.
column3: 其中我最喜欢听的，就是很久以前\n打败魔物军团的那个\n『银色之剑』的故事。

column2:
My favorite one is the one
about the silver sword used
to defeat the army of monsters
a long time ago.
Grandpa says the silver sword\nis still hidden somewhere in\nthis land, too!
column3: 有那把剑的话，\n就可以把魔物一刀两断了。\n如果传说是真的就好了。

column2:
Man, if we had that, I'll
bet we could totally whip
those monsters real good.
It would be awesome!
Grandpa says the silver sword\nis still hidden somewhere in\nthis land, too!

Man, if we had that, I'll
bet we could totally whip
those monsters real good.
It would be awesome!
column3: 咦！这就是传说的那把剑？

column2: Whoa, is that the\nsame sword from\nthe story?!
column3: ...砾害<1--。\n这么说，大哥哥\n你有办法打倒魔物啰？

column2: ...COOOOOOL! So does that\nmean you're gonna get rid\nof the monsters?!
column3: 你可以把魔物劈成两半对吧！

column2: Stupid monsters...\nGo get 'em, man!
Mister, are you a swordsman?
column3: 大哥哥，你是一名剑士吗？

column2: Well, the fortuneteller\nlady has been looking for\na traveling swordsman!
column3: 听说占卜师姐姐\n正在寻找旅行的剑士哦！

column2: Please go and see her!
column3: 记得要去找她哦！

column2:
The fortuneteller's house
is in the southwest corner
of town. You should go talk
to her right away!
column3: 占卜师姐姐的店\n在市区的西南角落。\n你一定要去找她哦！

column2: Hee-hee, isn't our town's\nfortuneteller super duper\nbeautiful?
column3: 嘻嘻，占卜师姐姐、\n长得很漂亮对吧。

column2: I went to visit Miss Sara,\nbut she wasn't there.
column3: 我去莎拉姐姐\n那里玩，可是那里，\n一个人也没有...。

column2: Where did she go...?
column3: 莎拉姐姐\n到底是去哪里了呢...？

column2:
Not long ago, I saw a stranger
in town wearing a black cape
with a real peculiar pale blue
glow to it...
column3:
最近经常看到披着黑色斗蓬
外地来的人。
那个斗蓬很古怪，
表面隐隐发出青色的雾光。

column2:
Maybe I was just seeing
things, I don't know...
but it still gave me the
shivers, either way!
column3: 或许是我眼睛花了，总之\n那个人给人毛骨悚然的感觉...

column2: Maybe that caped man was\nthe thief people have been\ntalking about...
column3: 说不定那披着黑斗蓬的男子\n是传闻中的盗贼呀。

column2:
I haven't seen that man in
the black cape lately. I'll
bet you anything he's the
one who killed Sara!
column3: 前不久还时常在街上出没的\n黑斗蓬的男人，又消失不见了。\n差不多就从莎拉被杀的那个时候开始。

column2:
Bad tidings... Things
are happening, and I
don't like where they're
headed...
column3: 可恶！\n怪不得我会有不祥的预感...

column2: Sara has been acting\nrather odd lately.
column3: 最近占卜师姐姐的样子\n怪怪的耶。

column2: She's been going on\nand on about the world\ncoming to an end...
column3: 老是喃喃自语说『世界要毁灭了』\n这种古怪的话...

column2:
Doesn't fill a man with much
confidence when a reputable
fortuneteller says the end of
the world is nigh, you know?
column3: 今后艾斯塔里亚\n到底会变成什么样子呢...

column2: With the monsters multiplying\nas rapidly as they are, Minea\ndoesn't seem so safe anymore!
column3: 魔物的数量一直不停增加，\n就连待在米内亚里面，\n也都变得不安全了！

column2:
I saw Pim pick a ring off the
ground the other day. Right after
that, he went straight to his
store and put it on the shelf!
column3:
刚刚我看到交换所的老板
在路边捡到戒指。
后来我就跑到他店里去看，
那个戒指已经被他摆在货架上了。

column2: What kind of low-life would\njust sell something he finds\nlike that?!
column3: 连捡到的失物都拿去卖，\n这家伙真是厚颜无耻。

column2:
If you find someone's valuables
on the ground, you should make
an effort to return them. It's
just the right thing to do!
column3: 真是，以后要注意，\n千万不能在路上掉东西。

column2: All Pim cares about is profit.\nI bet the owner of that ring\nnever even crossed his mind!
column3: 物归原主，有这种想法的人...\n已经没有了。

column2:
I thought I'd try selling an
old gem at Pim's, but he and
I couldn't see eye to eye on
its value.
column3: 我本来想把宝石卖给交换所，\n可是价钱谈不拢，n后来想乾脆就算了，不卖了。

column2: I wonder if I'd have gotten\nanywhere by being more\npersistent...
column3: 也许那时候我应该死缠烂打下去，\n说不定还可以成交...。

column2: What? You actually\ntalked him down?!
column3: 什么？\n你说那家伙答应你提的价格？

column2: You're really persistent...\nI could never do that!
column3: 你的执着太惊人了，要我像你我可办不到。

column2: I can't believe he caved...\nYou're really something,\nyou know that?
column3: 没想到他会妥协...\n这我实在学不来啊。

column2:
On a day like this, when the
weather is good, you can see
Darm Tower clear as anything
from the town's ramparts.
column3: 像今天这样的好天气，\n从城墙上就可以看到\n那座巨大无比的『达姆之塔』。

column2: It's amazing that our ancestors\nwere able to build a tower that\nstretches up beyond the clouds.
column3: 古时候的人还真是厉害。\n能建立起那个\n高耸入云的巨塔...。

column2:
Go up the mountain road from the
north village, and you'll reach
Darm Tower. The thieves are based
out of there, though, so take heed!
column3:
达姆之塔从北边的村子出发，
山路走到底就到了。
不过那里似乎已经成为盗贼窝，
我劝你最好还是不要靠近。

column2:
Whenever I look at that tower,
I get a cold chill down my
spine. It just seems so...
ominous!
column3: 对了，那座塔看着看着，\n身体就会感觉到一股寒气。\n这到底是为什么呢？

column2:
On the other side of the
northern pass, there's a
huge bowl-shaped crater
known as Bagyu Ba'dead.
column3: 北边的山路的另一边\n称为『巴丘·巴迪多』，\n那里有个钵状的巨大洞穴。

column2: Seems to be where the thieves\nare coming from. Guess they\nmade their hideout there.
column3: 最近为害本地的盗贼集团\n好像就是从那个方向过来的。

column2: The city walls keep the\nmonsters out...but no such\nluck with the thieves!
column3: 城墙挡得了魔物，可是，\n对盗贼就行不通了。

column2: Reah's harmonica was probably\nstolen by those inconsiderate\nfools...
column3: 说不定她的口琴\n就是被传说中的盗贼给夺走的也不一定。

column2:
If you think about it, though,
all the items the thieves have
stolen were made of silver.
Seems odd, doesn't it?
column3: 那些盗贼拿走的\n清一色都是些银制品...。\n这究竟是为了什么呢？

column2:
Ever since the silver mine on
the mountain was closed, the
cost of everything has risen
so dramatically!
column3:
自从矿山封闭了以后
物价一直不停的上涨。
真是，我快受不了啦。

column2:
Still, it's not like we could
actually SELL any of our silver
goods, what with the Stormwall
and all...
column3: 不过就算可以恢复采矿，\n有岚之结界挡在那里，\n不能做贸易还是一样没用。

column2: And needs have to come\nbefore wants, you know?
column3: 想要的东西那么多，\n还是得列个优先次序出来...

column2: Ahh, I wish business\nwould pick up again...
column3: 啊，希望生意能像原来一样好起来...

column2: Have you seen a one-eyed\nman around? His name is\nDonis...
column3: 你有没有看到只有一只眼睛的男人？\n他叫做多尼斯...。

column2:
Damned fool. He's down and
out right now, so he's been
neglecting his work. And he's
run off somewhere, to boot!
column3: 那个混蛋。\n一副要死不活的样子，\n好好的工作放着不干，不知道跑哪儿去了。

column2: That dumbass has\ndisappeared again.
column3: 多尼斯那家伙\n又跑不见人影了！

column2: All because he lost some ring\nhe wanted to give to his wife!
column3: 我看他弄丢要给老婆的戒指，\n还特别可怜他，\n对他特别客气了说！

column2: Stand aside, please. There\nare patients to be seen.
column3: 喂，让开让开！\n有人受伤了。

column2: Me? I'm Dr. Klaus.
column3: 我吗？\n我是克拉杰医生。

column2: Please, let me pass!\nI really must hurry!
column3: 喂，不要妨碍我！\n我现在忙得要命。

column2: If you're hurt, I'll examine\nyou later. For now, please\nstand aside!
column3: 喂！\n等你受伤了我再治你，总之\n现在请你让开！

column2: If I don't hurry, I'll be too\nlate to help. So if you'll\nexcuse me...
column3: 我不快走就来不及了<1！\n我要失陪了。

column2: Please stand aside. I'm\noff on an urgent house\ncall right now.
column3: 喂，麻烦你让开一下！\n我要赶去给人看病。

column2: Me? I'm Dr. Klaus.
column3: 我吗？\n我是克拉杰医生。

column2: Please, stand aside.\nI must see my patient.
column3: 麻烦你让开一下！\n我是来诊疗的。

column2: Me? I'm Dr. Klaus.
column3: 我吗？\n我是克拉杰医生。

column2: I'm in the middle of\nan examination.\nPlease, be quiet!
column3: 我正在给人看病，\n请你安静一下！\n

column2: I just got back from Sara's.\nPoor girl, to die so young...
column3: 我去莎拉的店看过了...\n那么年轻就...真是红颜薄命啊。

column2:
At the very least, she
seemed to be at peace.
Judging by the look in
her eyes, anyway.
column3: ...唯一令人安慰的是\n她走掉的样子很安祥。\n她的眼睛是这样诉说的。

column2: It looked as if she'd\naccomplished everything\nshe'd set out to do...
column3: 就好像她已经完成了\n自己应该完成的事情一样......

column2:
When the monsters started
attacking, a lot of people
moved here from Rastin and
Barbado Port.
column3: 自从魔物出现之后，\n许多人就从巴尔巴多和拉斯提尼村\n移居到这里来。

column2:
And yeah, Minea is protected
by walls, but we can't just
shut ourselves away in here.
We've got to fight back!
column3: 这里确实有城墙在守护没错，可是\n也不可能这样永远封闭下去啊。\n一定得想出将魔物扫荡一空的方法...。

column2: Not just monsters, either,\nbut thieves, too! I swear,\nit's one thing after another!
column3: 如果只是魔物也就算了，\n最近城内陆续发生失窃事件。\n唉...问题多到积堆如山了。

column2: The fortuneteller's been\nkilled...and we still have\nno idea who did it.
column3: 关于占卜师被杀事件...\n目前为止没有找到任何\n追查凶手的可疑线索。

column2: In light of that, the city\nwalls really don't seem all\nthat protective anymore...
column3: 不论哪一个问题，想要光靠城墙的守护，\n就安心渡日是绝不可能的吗...。

column2: Minea has an ancient history.\nSupposedly, its walls were\nbuilt a very long time ago.
column3: 米内亚有悠久的历史。\n听说这里的城墙\n是在很久很久以前建立的。

column2: It's like a miracle that people\nback then could build huge stone\nramparts like these.
column3: 光是能够完成，\n那么巨大的石墙这一点，\n就让人觉得很不可思议了。

column2: Makes you wonder how they\nmanaged it...
column3: 那么大片的石材墙壁\n当初究竟是怎么建造的呢。

column2: Ever since Sara's death,\nall the townsfolk have\nbeen nervous wrecks.
column3: 占卜师被杀的事件发生后，\n城里的人们\n都陷入不安的情绪之中。

column2:
I certainly can't blame them,
though. I mean, all of this
happened within the city walls!
Walls built to PROTECT us!
column3: 其实这也难怪。\n不管城墙再怎么坚固，\n也防不了城内的灾难啊...

column2: My mother lives by\nherself in Barbado.
column3: 我的母亲一个人\n在巴尔巴多生活。

column2:
I keep trying to tell her to
move in with me, since it's so
much safer inside the city
walls...but she won't listen.
column3: 我们跟她说过，那里没有城墙很危显\n请她搬过来跟我们一起住，可是\n她就是那么顽固，怎么说都说不听...

column2: I know she doesn't want to\nleave her lifelong home, but\nis it really worth the risk?
column3: 我知道她的心情，她不想离开\n住惯了的老家...\n可是你不觉得生命比那个更重要吗？

column2: I need to figure out a way\nto convince her...
column3: 该怎么样说服妈妈呢...

column2:
Since the monsters started
showing up, all the children
are prohibited from leaving
the city.
column3: 自从魔物出没之后，\n孩子们就全部被禁止\n出城游玩...

column2:
They look like they've grown
tired of being cooped up here,
but what else can we do? It's
for their own good!
column3:
可是阻止到现在，他们似乎已经
忍不住想要到外面去了。
但我们还能做什么呢？
这是为了保证他们的安全啊！

column2:
The path around the town walls is
pretty narrow. Transporting silver
to Barbado Port was a pain even
before the Stormwall, as a result.
column3:
城墙外侧的道路非常狭窄，
要很辛苦才能通过去。
结界发生前，运送开采到的银矿去
巴尔巴多港，一定很不容易。

column2:
We've considered erecting
a south gate, but we don't
want to compromise the wall's
structure, you know?
column3: 当初想建造南门，遇到城墙太坚固\n无法拆除的问题而作罢。幸好\n当初没拆掉，否则魔物出现还不知该怎么办。

column2:
We're very fortunate
to have Dr. Klaus in
our city. His potions
really hit the spot!
column3:
本地有位名叫克拉杰
的名医生。
他调配的药很有效，
不管什么样的伤马上都能治好。

column2: Anytime there's an emergency,\nhe's always there in a flash.\nHe's a true hero to us all.
column3: 一听到有急病的病人，\n他二话不说就马上赶到。\n真是位济世救人的好医生啊。

column2: ...But because he's always\noff on house calls, he's\nrarely at the clinic.
column3: 美中不足的是，因为他不辞辛劳到处看病，\n结果导致他待在医院的时间很少。

column2:
I have him scheduled to
come to my house for a
check-up, in fact. Bet
he'll show up any minute!
column3:
克拉杰医生很快
就会过来看病了。
不管刮风下雨他都一定会赶过来。
真是位济世救人的好医生啊。

column2:
The medicine the doctor
makes is really good stuff.
It'll cure what ails you,
real quick!
column3: 医生调配的药很有效，\n不管什么样的伤马上都能治好。

column2: Thanks to the good doctor,\nI can relax...
column3: 托医生的福，我们才能安心的生活。\n他真的是位好医生啊。

column2:
I just don't get it. She
was an eccentric one, sure,
but she had a good heart.
Who would do that to her?!
column3:
怎么会发生这么可怕的事呢。
虽然有点异于常人，不过，
她可是性情温和的好姑娘呀。
怎么会有人对她做出这种事？！

column2: Actually, speaking of Sara...\nI've been asking around to see\nif she has relatives anywhere...
column3: 对了...我听说那女孩\n好像在哪里有个亲戚呀。

column2:
Doesn't seem to be anyone
who knows, though. And if
she does have any relatives,
they really should be told!
column3: 那个亲戚是住在哪里呢...\n就算是不幸的消息，至少，还是应该把消息带到的。

column2:
We need to find her
relatives and break
the news to them...
...Oh? You already have?
column3: 我想无论如何得通知那个女孩的\n亲戚知道才可以...\n对了，你帮我去通知好吗。

column2: Well, it's awful news, but\nit's better to know than to\nwonder, right?
column3: 她的亲戚知道了可能会很难过吧。\n不过我认为他们应该会感谢你帮这个忙。

column2:
You must not go to the mine.
The monsters there are extremely
powerful. You'll be killed for
certain!
column3: 我强力建议你最好不要去矿山。\n那里的魔物可不是普通的强。\n你可能没几下就被打倒了。

column2:
It's fortunate for us
that they never venture
outside. Word is, they
can't stand daylight.
column3: 幸好矿山的魔物\n不会出来外头。\n有人说那里的魔怪害怕阳光照射。

column2:
But listen to me, warning
a stranger not to set foot
in a place no sane man
would dare enter anyway...
column3: 我想应该没有人\n会没事找事，跑去那个地方吧。

column2:
The mine is pitch black,
and hard to navigate on
account of the haphazard
tunnel structure.
column3: 矿山里面漆黑无光，而且结构复杂。\n这是当初为了挖白银，到处乱挖的结果。

column2:
Even if you're familiar with
it, it's quite easy to lose your
way. Not to mention, it's also
teeming with monsters!
column3: 矿坑里面像迷宫一样，\n就连老矿工也是经常迷路。\n更不用说已成为魔物巢穴的现在了。

column2: And the limited vision\nmakes it easy for things\nto sneak up on you...
column3: 总之在里面的视界有限，\n魔物往往从你料想不到的地方偷袭过来。

column2: If you're planning to enter the\nold mine, you'll need a strong\nwill and stronger steel.
column3: 如果你真的要去废矿坑，\n那你得有相当的实力跟心理准备才行。

column2: You went right into the\ndepths of that demon-\ninfested mine?!
column3: 你到魔物巢穴的废矿坑的最深处，\n去了一趟又回来了吗...

column2: Goodness gracious!
column3: 你太厉害了。

column2: My father is the mayor\nof Zepik Village, to\nthe north.
column3: 我父亲在北边的\n塞皮克村当村长。

column2: Lately, he's been a\nlittle preoccupied\nwith something, though.
column3: 最近他好像有什么\n很严重的烦恼的样子。

column2: Last time I saw him, he was\nall like, 'The villagers\nmustn't hear of this...'
column3: 上次我跟他碰面他还抱怨\n『对村里的人说不出口』\n等等之类的...

column2: Please...if you go to\nZepik Village, would\nyou talk to him for me?
column3: 求求你。\n如果你有要去塞皮克村的话，\n当我父亲商量的对象好吗？

column2:
It's so unlike him to be
so panicked and perturbed...
what in the world could have
put him in such a state?!
column3: 我头一次看到父亲那个样子...\n不知道到底发生了什么事？

column2: Please...if you go to\nZepik Village, would\nyou talk to him for me?
column3: 我求求你。\n如果你有要去塞皮克村的话，\n当我父亲商量的对象好吗？

column2: I heard from my father\nthat you retrieved his\nSilver Bell.
column3: 我听塞皮克村的父亲说了。\n听说你把银之铃\n拿回来给他了。

column2: Thank you so much,\nkindly adventurer.\nWe owe you our lives.
column3: 你一定要让我表达谢意。\n我由衷的感谢你。

column2:
We used to live in Rastin
Village. Until the monsters
razed it to the ground,
anyway...
column3: 我们本来是住在拉斯提尼村的。\n直到村子...被大群的魔物消灭之前...

column2:
The bats that come out from the
mine at twilight aren't normal.
They ferociously attack both
humans and livestock.
column3: 傍晚的时候从废矿坑跑出来的\n蝙蝠简直就不是一般蝙蝠...\n狂暴凶猛得吓人，还会攻击人类与家畜。

column2: They were the primary culprits\nin the destruction of Rastin.
column3: 我们世代居住的拉斯提尼村\n就为了它们，被...

column2:
You destroyed the boss
bat?! Wow... Now the dead
of Rastin Village can rest
in peace!
column3: 你把蝙蝠的老大打倒了吗。\n谢谢你...拉斯提尼村死掉的\n那些人在天之灵都会高兴吧。

column2:
My mother and grandfather
say they want to go back to
their old home, and they
look so sad about it...
column3: 每次我一说到想要回去老家，\n妈妈和爷爷就会露出悲伤的表情。\n这是为什么呢...？

column2: When the bats are gone, can\nwe go back to Rastin?
column3: 蝙蝠没有了的话，\n我们就能回去以前的家了吗？

column2:
When Rastin Village was
destroyed and we sought
refuge here, Reah's songs
were our only real solace.
column3: 拉斯提尼村子毁了，\n移居到这地方的当时，\n蕾雅的曲子真的给了我们很大的鼓励。

column2:
I just wish I could find
that harmonica she keeps
going on about, as a token
of my thanks to her...
column3: 为了报答她的恩情，\n我想帮她找回口琴...。

column2:
Say, isn't her harmonica made
of silver? Seems all the silver
stuff has been targeted by the
thieves lately. How very odd...
column3: 对了，那个口琴\n好像也是用白银做的哦？\n说不定跟最近的盗贼骚动有关系呢。

column2:
When Reah would play, it would
always make me feel so alive.
I just wish I could hear that
melody one more time...
column3: 听到那个曲子，心里就感到非常舒畅，\n燃起想要活下去的力量。\n好想再一次听到那首曲子啊...

column2: I love listening to Reah\nplay her harmonica. I hope\nthe thieves are caught soon!
column3: 我好喜欢大姐姐的口琴哦☆\n可以早点找到不知道该多好！

column2: I used to work in the silver\nmine. But six months ago, the\ntunnels were overrun by monsters!
column3: 本来我是在银矿山工作的。\n可是半年前矿坑深处突然\n冒出一大群的魔物！

column2:
It's all because of those damned
doomed dimmed dumbed monsters
that I got...I got nothin'...
t' do...but drink up...and out...
column3: 矿山因此封闭，我也失业了。\n这种情况叫我怎么能不借酒浇愁啊！

column2: I'll kill 'em... I'll moitelate\n'em...chop 'em to bits... I'll\nbe all like, BIFF! BAM! SKRONK!
column3: 妈的，我要把那些魔物一个二个都杀光光！

column2: ...Hahahaha, yeah, I know.\nThey'd be the ones doin' all\nthat stuff...
column3: ...说是这么说，\n那里乌漆摸黑的，就怕没杀成反而被杀。

column2:
Ahhh, my. Well, I have taken
a lot more outta alcohol than
alcohol's taken outta me, I
suppose... (hic)
column3: 气人啊~~~！\n我除了喝酒我还能怎么办！

column2: Huh? You went into\nthe mine?! But what\nabout the monsters?!
column3: 什么！你去过矿山的最深处了？\n...那些魔物呢？

column2: Sneaking around,\neh? I gotcha...
column3: ...多得要命对吧？我就说吧。

column2: You know that harmonica-\nplaying poet girl who hangs\naround up on the ramparts?
column3: 你知道在城墙的一角\n那个吹口琴的女吟游诗人吗？

column2: She's real purdy, and that\nsong o' hers is also real\npurdy. It's...mesmerizing...
column3: 不只人美，就连吹奏的曲子\n也美到让人陶醉呢。

column2: Haven't heard it in a\nwhile, though.
column3: 不过最近\n好久没听到那清澈的琴音了...

column2: Just looking at her is a\nreal feast for my eyes, but\nmy ears are getting starved!
column3: 光看她的人就已经很养眼了，\n再加上她的音乐，真是享受极了。

column2:
I saw that poet girl up on
the city walls. She was just
staring at the mountainside,
looking all sad...
column3: 我在城墙上看到吟游诗人了。\n她一脸悲伤的样子，\n一直望着山的方向...

column2: I wanted to talk to her,\nbut I got the feeling she\njust wanted to be alone...
column3: 我试着想找她讲话，可是\n那个气氛实在很难以靠近。

column2:
I saw this really sculpted,
scrumptious-looking man the
other day. Real debonair,
too, with his black cape!
column3: 我看到一个很帅的男人哦！\n黑色的斗蓬把他衬托得\n更加英俊迷人...

column2:
But when he looked at me,
I swear I was scared out of
my mind. His eyes...were
almost inhuman...
column3: 可当他看着我时，\n那眼神...不像人类...锐利得吓人，\n我不敢找他讲话...。

column2:
Hmmm... You're not too bad
yourself, actually. But you
might be a little young...
for what I have in mind.
column3: 嗯~~\n你的长相也不错啦，可是，\n年纪比我小耶...

column2: Ahh, my poor neighbor...
column3: 可怜的邻居...。

column2:
That guy in the black cape
was quite a specimen...
but you're really not too
bad yourself, either!
column3: 之前看到的穿黑色斗蓬的男人\n确实英俊，但是，\n你也是不亚于他的美男子哦。

column2:
Age to perfection, young man.
Age, and come back to me.
I'll be waiting for you
with bated breath!
column3: 美中不足的是...你比我年轻...

column2:
My, my, you certainly have...
ripened...since I saw you last.
Just look at how those muscles
have grown!
column3: 啊，才多久没见，\n你好像变得有男子气概了。

column2: ...I'm terrible, aren't I?\nI should leave such lechery\nto the men!
column3: ...我是不是有点过头了？\n再把你当成男孩可能太失礼了。

column2:
At any rate, I don't know who
it is you're trying so hard
for...but she's a very lucky
woman. A lucky woman, indeed!
column3: 我不知道你是为了谁这么努力啦，不过，\n她是个非常幸运的女人。\n真是个幸运的女人！

column2: Hey, Adol! You remember me?\nWe met in the portside\nwarehouse in Barbado!
column3: 嗨，这不是亚特鲁吗！\n你还记得我吗，我们在巴尔巴多的仓库碰过面对吧？

column2:
What am I doing here?
Well, I'm not sightseeing!
I came on militia-related
business, actually.
column3: 我可不是来玩的哦。\n我是为了自卫队的事而来的。

column2: Speaking of which, Slaff's\nbeen asking about you.
column3: 对了，斯拉夫\n一直很担心你的事哦。

column2: It'd be nice if you checked\nback with him sometime.
column3: 你就偶尔去找他一下吧。\n他会很开心的。

column2: Hey, Adol! You remember me?\nWe met in the portside\nwarehouse in Barbado!
column3: 嗨，这不是亚特鲁吗！\n你还记得我吗，我们在巴尔巴多的仓库碰过面对吧？

column2:
What am I doing here?
Well, I'm not sightseeing!
I came on militia-related
business, actually.
column3: 我可不是来玩的哦。\n我是为了自卫队的事而来的。

column2: It seems like something\nbig is happening...
column3: 听说这里也发生了\n重大状况...。

column2: I think these city walls\nare making us soft!
column3: 在城墙的保护下依然还是出事了。\n这下子我们得更加的提高警觉才行。

column2: (glug, glug, glug, glug)
column3: 咕噜咕噜咕噜...

column2: Aaaaaaahhhh!
Man, this is good stuff...
column3: 呼，凉冰冰的沁到五脏六腑去啦。

column2: Hey, bro... You want\na drink, too?
column3: 唷，小兄弟。\n你要不要也来喝一杯呀？

column2:
A minor? Only 17?! Man,
you're just a kid! I don't
even remember what I was
doing when I was your age...
column3: 未成年？17岁吗...这么年轻啊。\n我以前17岁的时候都在干什么？\n人呀，年老的速度真是快呀。

column2: Have you visited the\nfortuneteller's house?
column3: 你有去占卜店看了吗？

column2:
She may be young, but she's good.
If you're ever in need of advice
or guidance, she can always set
you on the right path.
column3:
那里的女老板虽然年轻，
不过占卜能力很强哦。
不知道自己该何去何从的时候，
可以去找她商量，挺不错的。

column2: You're that warrior Sara\nspoke of, are you not?
column3: 原来莎拉所说的旅行的剑士大人\n就是你啊。

column2:
She's always trying to protect
this land from any further
catastrophe. Hope you're up
to the task, chosen one!
column3: 莎拉她似乎想要阻止\n这个国家正在发生的灾难。\n拜托你，请不要让她的期待落空。

column2: I'm Esteria's foremost\ntour guide.
column3: 我的工作是艾斯塔里亚的旅游导游。

column2:
Or at least, I used to be.
That blasted Stormwall and
all the monsters have driven
me right out of business!
column3: 因为岚之结界跟魔物的关系，目前正在失业中。

column2:
There was once an odd old
man who wanted to tour the
mountain ruins-- this was
before the Stormwall.
column3: ...对了，岚之结界发生之前，\n我曾经带一位奇怪的老人到山上的遗迹。

column2: He seemed to be a scholar, and\nsaid he planned on investigating\nDarm Tower. I hope he's okay!
column3: 他看起来像是学者的样子。\n当时他还说要去达姆之塔。\n但愿他平安无事...。

column2:
That poor old man and I
parted ways at the old
shrine. Wonder if he's
even still alive...
column3: 后来我们走散了，不知道那个老爷爷要不要紧？

column2:
Yessir, I showed people all
the sights, from Darm Tower
to Whitehorn Beach, the old
shrine, and Bagyu Ba'dead...
column3: 达姆之塔跟白号角砂滩。\n古代的神殿、巴丘·巴迪多。

column2:
Playing tour guide takes
a lot out of you. Gotta
eat really well to stay
in shape for the job!
column3: 以前我还以为在这座岛上当导游，\n绝对不可能失业，结果，\n重要的游客不来我也没办法...

column2: Welcome. Oh, my,\na stranger!
column3: 欢迎光临。\n啊，以前从没看过你哦？

column2:
Don't worry, traveler. The city
of Minea is a safe haven from
the monsters. You have nothing
to worry about here!
column3: 待在城里不会有安全问题，旅行者，\n请在这里好好散心享乐吧。

column2: That poor fortuneteller.\nTo have died so young...
column3: 占卜师姐姐好可怜啊。\n她还那么年轻的说...

column2:
All the regulars here get
gloomier by the day. Though
granted, there isn't much
to be cheerful about lately...
column3: 来这里的客人，随着时间的经过，\n脸色一天比一天难看。\n不知道有没有什么让人开心的话题呢。

column2: Where did I get hurt, you\nask? In my own home, that's\nwhere! I was attacked!
column3: 你问我是在哪里受伤的？\n我只是待在家里就被莫名奇妙的攻击啦！

column2:
He hit me from behind, so
I didn't see his face...but
I'll bet anything it was one
of those damned thieves.
column3: 我是被人从背后殴打的，\n当然也就没看到脸了...\n不过我很笃定，一定是传说中的盗贼没错！

column2: And he stole the silver shield\nthat's been in my family for\ncountless generations...
column3: 竟然把代代相传的东西\n银色之盾给盗走...。

column2:
I had it tucked away in a
corner of my old storeroom.
Probably wasn't worth much,
but even so, it's the idea!
column3: 不过那东西过去一直被扔在\n仓库的一角没人整理，\n照理来说应该不是值钱的东西...

column2: First demons, then thieves...\nThere's no peace around here\nanymore!
column3: 先是魔物，现在又来盗贼...\n世界变得越来越危险了。

column2: That shield... It's the\none that was stolen from\nmy house!
column3: 那个正是我们家失窃的盾牌...。

column2: What's that? It was down in\nthe depths of the old shrine?\nHow the hell'd it get there?!
column3: ...你说什么，\n被藏在神殿的地下？\n怎么会有这么离奇的事呀...

column2: Well, you seem like you're\ngetting good use out of it.\nKeep it, man. I don't need it.
column3: 唷，年轻人，你若不嫌弃，\n就继续使用那个盾牌？

column2:
Actually, it almost feels like
the reason I've been holding on
to it all this time was so I
could give it to you...
column3: 不知为什么，我总有种感觉，\n那东西是为了交到你的手中，\n才在我家流传下来...

column2:
Better it be used to its full
potential than collect dust
in an old storage closet,
after all!
column3: 与其让盾牌摆在我家仓库蒙尘，\n还不如留在你的手中来得恰当。

column2: Indeed... I'd even say it\nsuits you. Brings out the\ncolor in your eyes!
column3: 确实如此...\n我甚至会说它很适合你。\n显得你眼眸中的颜色更加鲜艳。

column2:
The wild dogs out in the field
are called Rhebolls. They're
extremely fast, so take heed
around them.
column3: 草原的野狗『利伯鲁』\n跑的速度很快，对它要小心一点。

column2: I got surrounded by a whole\nherd of them-- which is how\nI came to be in this state!
column3: 我就是被它们包围，变成了这副样子。

column2:
I managed to slip away and run
to the big tree in the field.
For some reason, the Rhebolls
turned back at that point.
column3: 不过...当我逃到\n草原上的大树附近时，\n那些利伯鲁就停下来不追了。

column2:
As a result, I'm still alive,
and not TOO much worse for the
wear. But I do wonder what it
was that drove them away...
column3: 要不是这样，恐怕就不只是受伤而已了。\n我实在搞不明白，那到底是怎么回事...？

column2:
Either way, I owe my life
to that tree. Or something
in the air around it. Or
perhaps just divine mercy!
column3:
唉，不管怎样，
我能活着都是多亏了那棵树...
或者是它周围空气中的什么东西...
也或者是神灵的怜悯！

column2: Mrmmm...hrrmmm...
column3: 嗯嗯嗯嗯...呼噜噜...

column2: The pikkards...\nYou must...double...\ndown...
column3: 嘿嘿嘿，伤脑筋...

column2: Zzzz...
Hoooo....mmmmm....
...Save me...\nThis is no puppy...\n...It's a...Rheboll...!
column3: 救命呀...野狗，利伯鲁来啦...

column2: *snore*
column3: 呼噜噜...

column2: Who...are you...?
Adol introduced himself and explained\nhis reason for coming to the shrine.
column3: \n亚特鲁报出自己的姓名，\n并说明来到神殿的目的。

column2: ...My name is Feena. It feels like\nI've been locked up down here for\nmy entire life...
column3: 我的名字叫...菲娜。\n从很久以前开始，一直被关在这地方。

column2: I remember, it was a man in a\nblack cape who put me here...
column3: 把我囚禁在这里的人，\n是穿着黑色斗蓬的男人...

column2: He is a terrible man, who seems to\ncontrol the very movements of the\nmonsters.
column3: 他操纵魔物像控制自己的手脚一样，好可怕啊。

column2: It's dangerous here. You should\nforget about me... Please, hurry,\nget away from here, while you can!
column3: 留在这里你也会有危险。\n不要担心我...你快点走吧。

column2: Take her with you
column3: 带她离开

column2: Come back later
column3: 稍后再来解救

column2: You're... You're going to help me?
column3: 你是说...你要救我出去？

column2: ...You're saying...I can leave\nthis place?
column3: 不敢相信...\n我竟然能离开这里...

column2: Adol...
column3: 亚特鲁...先生。

column2: Thank you so very much...
column3: 谢谢你...

column2: Adol swore to Feena that he would\nlead her to a safe place.
column3: 决定了，护送被囚禁的\n少女菲娜到\n安全的地方去吧。

column2: You needn't worry about me.\nI am incidental.
column3: 请你不要在意...\n我的事情。

column2: You said you were searching for\nsomething, no?
column3: 重要的是你正在做的事。\n你不是说你在寻找什么吗？

column2: I am...oddly familiar with this\nshrine, and I believe its lower\nlevels are riddled with secrets.
column3: 神殿的地下好像设有\n很多机关的样子。

column2: Secrets invisible to the naked eye.\nAnd you must know how to discern\nthem, if you are to proceed.
column3: 有些地方是要看\n破解机关之后才能进入的...

column2: Please, take this with you.
column3: 这个请你拿去吧。

column2: The man in the black cape put\nthat mask in here with me.
column3: 面具是穿着黑色斗蓬的人\n收纳在这个房间的...

column2: I believe it will be of some use\nto you.
column3: 我想这个你一定会需要用到的。

column2: Adol Christin. Leave this place,\nas quickly as you can!
column3: 亚特鲁先生...\n请赶快离开这里。

column2: If the monsters should catch you\nhere, I'm loathe to think of what\nmay happen to you...
column3: 被巡逻的魔物发现就糟了。

column2: Adol. Please, take care.
column3: 亚特鲁先生，希望你平安无事...

column2: Adol, are you okay?
column3: 亚特鲁先生，你平安无事吗？

column2: I'm glad to see you.
column3: 太好了...

column2: Did you find what you were\nsearching for?
column3: 你找到你在寻找的东西了是吧。

column2: ...What? You're going to...get\nme out of here...?
column3: ...咦？你说要带我出去？

column2: Adol couldn't help but\nthink of the girl trapped\nin the dungeon cell.
column3: 不行，心里老是挂念着\n被囚禁的那个少女。

column2: He knew he had to\ngo back for her.
column3: 不行，不能放着她不管。

column2: Feena seems to have gotten\nherself lost somewhere. She\nis no longer following Adol.
column3: 菲娜没有跟过来。\n 她好像走失了。

column2: Adol cannot leave\nFeena behind.
column3: 我不能只顾自己回去，\n丢下她不管。

column2: This item doesn't have the\npower to transport two people.
column3: 看来这个道具的力量\n并不足以\n一次传送两个人回去。

column2: Adol cannot leave\nFeena behind.
column3: 我不能丢下她，\n一个人回去。

column2: This stairway leads\nto the lower levels\nof the shrine.
column3: 有个通往地下的楼梯。

column2: Adol would never place Feena\nin danger by leading her to\nsuch a place.
column3: 我不能再带着她\n到危险的地方去冒险。

column2: This stairway leads\nto the lower levels\nof the shrine.
column3: 有个通往地下的楼梯。

column2: Adol cannot leave\nFeena behind.
column3: 我不能丢下她离开。

column2: Adol found a hidden\nroom behind the wall.
column3: 发现墙壁内的密室。

column2: The man in the black cape put\nthat mask in here with me.
column3: 面具是穿着黑色斗蓬的人\n收纳在这个房间的...

column2: Perhaps it could be of some use\nto you.
column3: 我想这个你一定会需要用到。

column2: It's a dead end...
column3: 好像走进死路了...

column2: Um... Adol... It's a bit, uh, tight\nback here, don't you think?
column3: 啊...亚特鲁先生...\n这里太窄了...

column2: It's a dead end...
column3: 好像走进死路了...

column2: Um... Adol? You're kind of scaring me\nright now...
column3: 呃...亚特鲁先生...\n那个面具...有点令人害怕。

column2: Feena seems to have gotten\nherself lost somewhere. She\nis no longer following Adol.
column3: 她没有跟上来。\n好像走失了。

column2: Feena is watching Adol from\nthe next room, scared. She\nis no longer following him.
column3: 她没有跟上来。\n停在之前的房间，不安地看着这边。

column2: I'm...afraid to go any\nfarther in...
column3: 前面好可怕...我不敢过去...。

column2: This really is no place\nfor you to be bringing\na young girl!
column3: 你怎么可以带一位小姐到这种地方啊。

column2: Either way, is she all\nright? She doesn't look\nparticularly well...
column3: 没问题吧？\n那位小姐的脸色很差的样子哦...

column2: My grandmother Jeba lives in\nthe village at the bottom of\nthe mountain.
column3: 我的奶奶洁瓦就住在山麓的村庄里。

column2: Oh, you know her already? Well,\nthen what are you doing here?!
column3: ...什么，你说你知道她？\n这样事情就好办了。\n去跟她说明情况，给那女孩休息吧。

column2: Get that girl to my grandmother's\nhouse in Zepik Village, before she\nhas a heart attack or something!
column3: 你还慢吞吞的做什么。\n快把人带过去啊！不要有什么三长两短了！

column2: Oh, my, welcome to our\noh-so-humble abode.
column3: 哦，欢迎光临我们这个破地方。

column2: But miss, have\nyou not heard?
column3: 我说这位小姐呀。\n你没有听说过吗？

column2: This is a place of ill\nrepute. A den of thieves.
column3: 这里可是恶盟昭彰的盗贼碉堡哦。

column2:
Pretty thoughtless to bring
a girl like you to a place
like this. Wanna ditch the
zero, and go grab a drink?
column3: 别管那个把你带入险境的薄情的小兄弟，\n来跟我喝杯茶聊聊天，\n怎么样呀？

column2: Leave your money and your\ngirl, and get out. Now!
column3: 把钱跟女人留下，滚蛋！

column2: ...I'm not serious, but what\nif I were? Not like you could\ndo anything about it!
column3: 要是遇到这样的事怎么办呀？\n你也太没有防备了。

column2: Lucky for you, we only\nantagonize the filthy\nrich. Emphasis on filthy.
column3: 放心啦。\n我们只挑黑心的有钱人下手。

column2: I...I'm all right...Adol...
column3: 我没事的...亚特鲁先生。

column2: I'm just tired, that's all...
column3: 我只是有点累了而已...\n

column2: Don't...worry...about me...
column3: 请你...不要在意...

column2: Feena lapsed into unconsciousness.\nAdol felt her forehead, and confirmed\nthat she had a fever.
column3: 菲娜\n闭上眼睛失去了意识。\n摸她的额头，非常的烫。

column2: Luckily, Jeba's house\nwas very close.
column3: 幸好洁瓦的家就在附近。

column2: Adol gently lifted Feena over\nhis shoulder, and promptly\ncarried her to Jeba's.
column3: 亚特鲁背起菲娜，\n奔向洁瓦家。

column2: ...She's sleeping well.
column3: ...睡得很熟的样子。

column2: The medicine should help. Add a\ngood night's rest, and she should\nbe fine by morning.
column3: 药力开始生效了，\n睡了一晚之后应该会恢复元气吧。

column2: Still... No matter how you look at\nit, it's a very strange story.
column3: 不过...这件事越听越觉得不可思议呀。

column2: The sacred inner sanctum, sealed\nunder the shrine for so long,\nbecoming home to monsters...
column3: 长期以来一直被封印的地下圣域，\n竟然不知不觉中成为魔物的巢穴...

column2: And a girl imprisoned there,\nno less! So much of this simply\ndoesn't add up...
column3: 而那个女孩，\n又一直被囚禁在圣域里面...\n嗯...让人搞不明白的事情还真多呀。

column2: The medicine seemed to have kicked\nin. Feena's breathing was steady,\nand her fever had subsided.
column3: 不知是不是药力的作用，\n菲娜睡得很沉，\n呼吸也平稳多了...

column2: Don't you worry, I'll take good\ncare of her.
column3: 我会为你照顾那孩子的。

column2: She'll be up and about soon\nenough, good as new!
column3: 不用担心了。\n再过不久她自然会清醒过来。

column2: Adol...
column3: 亚特鲁先生...

column2: I can never thank you enough for\nrescuing me from that prison cell.\nIt feels so good to be free!
column3: 谢谢你，\n把我从地牢中救了出来。\n我真的好高兴...

column2: I still can't remember anything\nbut my name, though.
column3: 我只记得自己的名字，菲娜...\n其他的一点记忆都没有。

column2: Who am I? What have I done with my\nlife? And why was I locked in that\ncell in the first place?
column3: 我不知道以前过着什么样的生活...\n也不知道自己为什么被关在神殿...。

column2: I don't know the answers to any of\nit. I only know that my name is\nFeena, and I've been a prisoner.
column3: ...什么都不知道，一片空白。

column2: Why can't I remember anything\nmore...?
This is a lovely village. Jeba\nintroduced me to the villagers,\nand everyone seems so very nice.
column3: ...这个村子真好。\n不论是洁瓦，还是其它人，\n大家对我都很亲切。

column2: This is the first time I can recall\nwhen I've felt so at peace...
column3: 这种安心放松的感觉，彷佛...\n我已经失去了很久。

column2: I don't really care if I never get\nmy memories back. If I could stay\nin this place, with these people...
column3: 只要这种和平的生活可以持续下去...\n就算没恢复记忆我也不在乎...

column2: ...I know, I know. I should be\ntrying harder to remember. But I'm\njust...so happy here!
column3: 有时候...我就是会不禁这么想。

column2: ...You're not from Esteria.\nWho are you? No one has ever\nmade it past the Stormwall!
column3: 你不是艾斯塔里亚的人吧？\n真难得...\n『岚之结界』也会有漏网之鱼啊。

column2: If you feel like you need some\nguidance, I recommend paying a\nvisit to the fortuneteller in Minea.
column3: 当你找不到自己的道路时，\n可以去问米内亚的占占卜师。\n她应该会给你一些建议。

column2: Sara's Crystal...
column3: 那水晶是莎拉的...

column2: I see. So you're the swordsman Sara\nhas been seeking all this time.
column3: 原来你就是莎拉找到的剑士啊。

column2: You intend to find the Book of\nYs within the shrine, do you?
column3: 你想去寻找神殿的\n『伊苏之书』是吗...

column2: I believe you'll be needing this\nkey, then.
column3: 那么你就拿这把钥匙去吧。

column2: The ruins atop the mountain were\nonce known as Solomon Shrine.
column3: 山上的神殿在古时候\n据说被称为『萨尔蒙神殿』。

column2: If one of the Books of Ys is there,\nit will no doubt be somewhere in\nthe #02shrine's lower levels.
column3: 如果那里真有伊苏之书的话...\n我想应该就在圣域#02神殿的地下#00吧。

column2: The entrance to the lower levels\nis well-hidden, but that Crystal\nwill show you the way.
column3: 通往地下的入口是被封印起来的，\n那颗水晶应该可以为你打开道路。

column2: Virtually anything may await you in\nthere, however. Make certain you're\nwell prepared before you go.
column3: 总之什么事都有可能发生。\n做好万全的准备后就出发吧。

column2: Adol...!
column3: 亚特鲁先生...！

column2: Don't worry about Feena.\nShe's feeling just fine.
column3: 这孩子的事你不用担心。\n她已经完全康复了。

column2: Her fever wasn't anything serious.\nShe was just fatigued from her long\nand frightening ordeal.
column3: 看来她发烧的原因，只是疲累过度而已。

column2: ...I'm sorry, Adol.
column3: ...对不起，亚特鲁先生。

column2: I can't believe I just collapsed\nlike that, without even properly\nthanking you.
column3: 我没有向你道谢就病倒了...

column2: It's a bit late now, but...thank\nyou, Adol Christin, for saving me\nfrom that dark, dank prison.
column3: 谢谢你...\n把我救出来。

column2: What will you do?
column3: 要做什么？

column2: Speak to Jeba
column3: 与洁瓦讲话

column2: Speak to Feena
column3: 与菲娜讲话

column2: Leave
column3: 不讲话了

column2: I'll continue looking after Feena\nfor a while.
column3: 这孩子就暂时留在我这儿吧。

column2: I think some of the area's less\nsavory inhabitants have taken\nan unhealthy interest in her.
column3: 我看似乎有些来路不明\n的坏人在打她的主意。

column2: I see... So you really did find\na Book of Ys in the shrine.
column3: 是吗...\n你真的在神殿发现了伊苏之书啊。

column2: A distant look washed over Jeba's face.
column3: \n洁瓦的眼神显得有些寂寞。

column2: It seems the wheel of fate...\nhas begun turning anew...
column3: 命运的纺车...开始转动了吗...

column2: You've done well. Now, quickly,\nyou must take the book to Sara.
column3: ...辛苦你了。\n好了，快把那本书拿去给莎拉吧。

column2: What's wrong? You look as if\nyou've seen a ghost!
column3: 哦，怎么了吗。\n你的脸色有点差哦？

column2: Adol told Jeba of Sara's passing.
column3: \n亚特鲁将莎拉死去的消息告诉洁瓦。

column2: I see.
I had a terrible premonition that\nsomething like this might happen.
column3: 怪不得我一直有种不祥的预感。

column2: Sara, too...seemed to know the fate\nthat stood before her. I suppose it\nwas her job to know, after all.
column3: 莎拉自己应该...\n也有觉悟到自己的命运吧...

column2: Does that bother you? If it sets\nyour mind at ease, do know that she\nhad completely accepted her destiny.
column3: 你在意莎拉的事是吗？\n那女孩一直很明白自己的命运。

column2: We shall both grieve, certainly.\nBut if you wish to honor her memory,\nthen...carry out her final wish.
column3: 你真那么伤心的话，\n就帮她把未完的事做完吧。

column2: What will you do?
column3: 要做什么？

column2: Speak to Jeba
column3: 与洁瓦讲话

column2: Speak to Feena
column3: 与菲娜讲话

column2: Ask Jeba to read
column3: 请她解读

column2: Leave
column3: 不讲话了

column2: Why would I be imprisoned in such a\nplace...?
column3: ...为什么\n我会被关在那个地方...

column2: Try as I might, I simply cannot\nremember!
column3: 我依然还是不知道。

column2: My memories are of the prison, and my\nown name. Nothing else.
column3: 我记得的，只有在牢房里的一点点记忆，\n以及自己的名字而已...

column2: And whenever I attempt to focus and\nremember anything else, all that\ncomes to me is a headache...
column3: 每当我想去回忆过去的事，\n就会头疼欲裂...

column2: Jeba is letting me stay with her\nfor as long as I need.
column3: 经过一阵商量，\n决定让菲娜暂时留在洁瓦家。

column2: I...would like it if you'd come by\nto visit me from time to time, as\nwell. If you aren't busy, of course!
column3: 那个...有时间的时候\n过来看我一下，我会很高兴的...

column2: Ah, it's you. If you're looking for\nFeena, she went out for a walk\naround the village.
column3: 哦，是你啊。\n要找菲娜的话，她现在应该在村子里散步吧。\n

column2: What's wrong? You don't look well.
column3: ...怎么了吗。\n你的脸色有点差哦？

column2: Adol told Jeba of Sara's passing.
column3: \n亚特鲁告诉洁瓦莎拉的死讯。

column2: I see.
I had a terrible premonition that\nsomething like this might happen.
column3: 怪不得我一直有种...不祥的预感。

column2: Sara, too...seemed to know the fate\nthat stood before her. I suppose it\nwas her job to know, after all.
column3: 莎拉自己应该...\n也有觉悟到自己的命运吧...

column2: Does that bother you? If it sets\nyour mind at ease, do know that she\nhad completely accepted her destiny.
column3: 你很在意莎拉的事吗？\n她一直很明白自己的命运的。

column2: We shall both grieve, certainly.\nBut if you wish to honor her memory,\nthen...carry out her final wish.
column3: 你真那么伤心的话，\n就帮她把未完的事做完吧。

column2: What will you do?
column3: 要做什么？

column2: Speak to Jeba
column3: 与洁瓦讲话

column2: Ask Jeba to read
column3: 请她解读

column2: Leave
column3: 不讲话了

column2: Long ago, Ys was ruled by two\nGoddesses and six Priests.
column3: ...据传，古代的伊苏国是由\n二位女神与六位神官所统治。

column2: Sara and I are descended from one of\nthese Priests. Much of Sara's power\ncame from the Tovah bloodline.
column3: 我与莎拉就是神官托霸的后代。\n特别是莎拉，明显的继承了神官祖先的力量...。

column2: I suspect she knew more about the\ndisasters befalling Esteria than\nanyone could've imagined...
column3: 也许她的眼中，早就已经看到\n正在逼近的灾难的全貌...

column2: ...Well, we cannot grieve Sara's loss\nforever.
column3: ...人是不可能\n永远沉浸在悲伤的情感之中的。

column2: In order to grant her dying wish,\nyou must continue onward, Adol.\nYou must find the Books of Ys!
column3: 为了继承莎拉的遗志...\n我会尽我所有的力量来协助你。

column2: I am fully convinced that you are\nthe swordsman whose coming Sara\nforetold.
column3: 毕竟不管怎么说，\n你可是她找到的剑士啊。

column2: At any rate... The Books of Ys...
column3: 接着嘛...先说『伊苏之书』吧。

column2: I'm a bit rusty...but with Sara\ngone, I am the only one left who\ncan read the ancient script.
column3: 莎拉已经不在了，\n能解读古文字的人，世上恐怕就只剩下我啰。

column2: Which shall I read?
column3: 要读哪一章？

column2: Volume Hadal
column3: 哈达尔之章

column2: Volume Tovah
column3: 托霸之章

column2: Volume Dabbie
column3: 达比之章

column2: None for now
column3: 不读了

column2: So this is the book you found\nin the shrine...
column3: 这就是在神殿找到的吗...

column2: This is the Book of Ys lost from\nour family's storehouse, long ago.
column3: 这不是我们托霸家遗失的\n伊苏之书吗...

column2: So...it was in the abandoned mine,\nwas it? How peculiar...
column3: 废矿坑的深处...\n竟然在那种地方呀。

column2: The words recorded in these books\nwill surely illuminate the truth\nbehind Esteria's turmoil...
column3: 书上记载的内容\n应该会为我们解明\n一连串事件背后的真相。

column2: The Stormwall... The appearance of\nthe monsters... The continued theft\nof all items made from silver...
column3: 岚之结界...魔物的出现...\n银制品的失窃事件...

column2: And now, Sara's death...
column3: 还有莎拉的死...

column2: I'm certain that all of this stems\nfrom a great instability in the\nflow of destiny.
column3: ...这些事件，\n只是正在发生的历史巨变中\n的小插曲。

column2: You are the only one with the\nability to uncover the truth\nbehind it all!
column3: 知道这些事的人，可能就只有你了。

column2: What will you do?
column3: 要做什么？
